She buys jewelry of different designs from market at lower rates and sells them to her community. She counts a good client list; most her clients are her neighbors.
  
She is the mother of 3 children. All of them go to school. She wishes to send other children to school but is unable to cover the expenses. She has gradually improved her business. Now she has requested a loan of Rs. 25,000. She is going to use this loan to buy a sample of jewelry from market at lower rates. She intends to use the earned profits on her children’s educations. She purchases the jewelry parts from the shalmi market at lower rates and sells it in these markets at the maximum price that is suitable to both of them.

loans.use: to buy a sample of jewellery from market at lower rates

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita, 44. She is a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Julian and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Nenita oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one unit of tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business, the regular customers are the local community members. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippines pesos (Php) every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and accessories and also to pay for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Nenita dreams to be able to give her family a good life and hopes to give her children and grandchildren a good and quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Aguilas Group

texts.es:
Águilas son un grupo solidario conformado por 6 mujeres emprendedoras que estaban decididas a salir adelante junto con sus familias; se llamas águilas porque sus sueños llegan a ser tan altos como el vuelo de las mismas. Petra es una de las integrantes del grupo, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, 2 hombres de 25 y 21 años, los cuales trabajan para contribuir en los gastos del hogar y una niña que cursa el 4to grado de primaria. La señora Petra se dedica a la venta de tacos, gorditas y comida sana para los niños, tiene su puesto enfrente de una escuela. Con el crédito comprara todo lo necesario para preparar los tacos y las gorditas, surtirá su tanque de gas, etc..

Una meta muy importante para Petra es establecer su negocio formalmente y poder abrir todo el día, ya que normalmente abría en las mañana.
texts.en:
Águilas is a group made up of six enterprising women, dedicated to getting ahead with their families.  They are called “Águilas” (Eagles) because their dreams are to become as high as the flight of Eagles.  Petra is one of the group’s members.  She’s married, and has three children, two sons ages 25 and 21 who work to help with the household expenses, and one daughter in fourth grade.  Petra sells tacos, gorditas, and healthy food for children.  She has her stand set up across from the school.  She will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients to make her tacos and gorditas, refill her cooking gas, etc.
 
One of Petra’s important goals is to set up a formal business and be able to open it all day; normally she is only open in the mornings.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and cooking fuel

loans.name: Gimema

texts.en:
Gimema is 49 years old and married with seven children.

Gimema works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like shoes, bags, pants, and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Gimema has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business for four years and also earns an income by selling frozen foods.

Gimema aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shoes, bags, pants, and other ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dried fish to resell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years.

Gemma requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like snack foods, soap, sugar, and other groceries.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods, soap, sugar, and other groceries for her store

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en:
Jelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a salt retail business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Jelyn requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

In the future, Jelyn would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of salt to sell

loans.name: Raheela

texts.en:
Ms. Raheela is a 48-year-old married woman. Five years ago, she started her own business of clothing sales when her husband got severely ill. She didn’t lose hope and contacted Kashf Foundation upon the advice of her neighbor to initiate her own business. She buys cloth of different designs from the market in bulk at lower rates and sells to her community. She counts a good client list; most of her clients are her neighbors.
  
She is the mother of eight children. Seven of them are going to school. She wishes to send her other child to school but is unable to cover the expenses. Raheela has gradually improved her business. Now she has requested a loan of Rs 40,000. She is going to use this loan to buy a sample variety of clothes in larger quantity to add to her current ones. She intends to use the earned profits on her children’s education. She also teaches people trailing and gets machines to increase her business from the use of the loan.

loans.use: To buy a sample variety of clothes in larger quantity to add to her current ones

loans.name: Tima

texts.en: Tima is 38 years old, is an entrepreneur and is dedicated to her home. She lives together with her husband and seven children. Tima works making and selling dumplings. She makes the dumplings in her home, selling a small quantity right from her home and selling the rest in different neighborhoods. With the goal of increasing her sales and improving her earnings, Tima is asking for a loan in order to buy a larger amount of ingredients like wheat flour, baking powder, cooking oil and flavorings, as well as firewood for cooking. Tima is a very positive person who fights for the hope of being able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger amount of ingredients to make and sell dumplings

loans.name: Merpati S

texts.en:
Merpati is a 41-year-old widow. She is blessed with five children: Inkun, 19, a college student; Christianus, 18, graduated from senior high school; Christantri, 12, is attending the first grade of junior high school; Christologos, 9, is attending the fifth class of elementary school; and Christian, 5, is not attending school yet. 

Merpati runs a second-hand clothing business. She has been operating the business since 2009. Merpati rents a small stall at a local market to display her products. The business begins at 8 am and ends at 4 pm each day. Merpati wants to expand the business. She sees opportunity to generate more income by opening a kiosk. To do so, she is requesting loan from TLM amounting to IDR 10,000,000. She would like to use the loan to buy items like biscuits, soft drinks, snacks, coffee, sugar, cigarettes and shampoo, as well as two sacks of second-hand clothes.

loans.use: to buy items like biscuits, soft drinks, snacks, coffee, sugar, cigarettes and shampoo, as well as two sacks of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Mwanaulu

texts.en: Mwanaulu continues selling local liquor in her neighborhood. It is a business it has allowed her to increase her income. Mwanaulu says that her aim is to improve her living standards. She is requesting a new loan so as to invest in her existing business. This is a second loan she is requesting both from Yehu and Kiva. This loan will enable her to purchase tables and seats so that her customers can have a more comfortable place to enjoy themselves. Her goal is to have a a bigger store to accommodate more customers.

loans.use: to purchase tables and seats for her palm wine-selling business

loans.name: Ernesto Porfirio

texts.es: Ernesto de 50 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos quienes se dedican a estudiar y por quienes Ernesto trabaja muy duro. Él posee una venta de gorras, gelatinas para el cabello, champo, cremas, talcos, galletas y otros productos más. Ernesto posee varios clientes fijos debido a que su puesto está ubicado en el centro del lugar que reside, un lugar muy concurrido y de mucho comercio, lo que beneficia a Ernesto. Él solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder comprar mayor variedad de gorras, y así mismo comprar más productos para ofrecer a las personas. Con esto Ernesto podrá aumentar en gran manera sus ventas ya que ofrecerá más productos, lo cual serpa de mucho beneficio para su familia.
texts.en: Ernesto is 50 years old, he lives with his wife and three children who all study and for whom Ernesto works very hard. He runs a business that sells hats, hair gel, shampoo, creams, talc, cookies and other products. Ernesto has various loyal customers thanks to his location that is right in the center of the place where he lives, a place very much frequented and with a lot of business, which is good for Ernesto. He is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL in order to purchase a variety of hats and also to purchase more products to offer to people. With this, Ernesto will be able to increase his sales in a big way since he will be offering more products, which will benefit his family as well.

loans.use: purchase hats and hair products to re-sell.

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 58 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, reside en una comunidad rural del Municipio de Gracias, Departamento de Lempira.
Ella inicio su negocio de venta de comida y golosinas hace 8 años, con el fin de adquirir recursos económicos para la subsistencia.
Doña María elabora tamales, ticucos (alimento típico de maíz, condimentos y carne) y pan para la venta ambulante, además en su vivienda vende golosinas, abarrotes, dulces y condimentos.
Con el propósito de surtir su negocio y comprar materia prima (harina de maíz y carne), ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 8,000 Lempiras.
Sus planes a futuro es aumentar las ventas y con las ganancias crecer económicamente para apoyar a su hija con quien convive actualmente.
texts.en:
Maria, 58, is a single mother of 2.  She lives in a rural community in the municipality of Gracias, which is in the department of Lempira.

Maria started her business selling food and snacks 8 years ago, with the goal of making a living through the business.

Maria makes tamales, ticucos (a traditional dish made from corn, condiments and meat), and bread to sell.  She sells her dishes from place to place, and she also sells snacks, groceries, sweets and condiments from her home.

In order to stock up her business and buy supplies (corn flour and meat), she has requested a loan of 8,000 Honduran lempiras.  

In the future, Maria plans to increase her sales and earnings so that she can support the daughter who is currently living with her.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make food to sell (corn flour and meat), and to buy snacks

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is a married woman with one child. She is 36 years old and lives in Sepac, Sapang Dalaga. 

Mely owns and operates a plot of farmland and plants bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 4 years and earns PHP 4,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase farm chemicals. 

Mely joined Kiva's partner, GDMPC, last year. Mely's plan is to save her returns in order to expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.ru: Фирдавс проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 31 год. Он женат. У него двое детей. Фирдавс предоставляет услугу, он работает таксистом. В этой области он работает два года. Фирдавс просит кредит для ремонта своего автомобиля. Он нуждается в поддержке.
texts.en: Firdavs lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 31 years old, married, and has 2 children. Firdavs works in the service sector. He drives a taxi, and has been working in this field for two years. Firdavs is seeking a loan in order to repair his vehicle. He needs your support.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Negociantes Group

texts.es: Son un grupo muy trabajador y puntual, llevan con la empresa 4 ciclos y tienen sus juntas en el municipio de Monterrey. La señora Noemí es una mujer muy activa tiene 54 años de edad, es casada (su esposo era trailero, pero esta pensionado) y tiene 2 hijos, uno de 29 años, es casado y es jefe de turno en una famosa empresa de telecomunicaciones. Y el menor próximamente se casara y trabaja como operador de tráileres. Noemí se dedica a la venta de repostería, tiene con su negocio 15 años, comenzó la venta, ya que dejo de trabajar como enfermera y como su esposo la dejaba sola en su casa debido a su empleo, a ella no le gustaba estar sin hacer nada. Ella tiene mucha venta los días festivos y el crédito la ayudara comprando mas materia prima como moldes, harina, azúcar, 2 fuentes chocolateras para poder rentarlas. En un futuro Noemí desea tener su propia panadería, ya que tiene muchos clientes y una gran fama como buena repostera. Negociantes nos mencionan que les gusta ser un grupo pequeño, ya que piensan que si fueran mas personas batallarían para poder juntarse y para dar los pagos, ellas prefieren ser un grupo pequeño y con integrantes que se conozcan muy bien.
texts.en: They are a very hard working and punctual group and have four cycles with their business and meet in the municipal of Monterrey. Mrs. Noemí  is a very active woman who is 54 years old, is married (her husband was a truck driver, but now he is retired) and has two children, one is 29 years old, married and the boss of a famous telecommunications business. And the youngest is soon to be married and works as a truck operator. Noemí has a baking business, which she has been running for 15 years, she started selling her products and she quit her job as a nurse and because her husband left her alone at home a lot because of his job, she didn't like to be there with nothing to do. She sells a lot on festival days and the loan will help her purchase more primary materials like molds, flour, sugar and two chocolate fountains so she can rent the latter. In the future, Noemí  would like to have her own bakery since she has a lot of customers and a good reputation as a baker. The group mentions they like to remain small since they think that more people would add strife in their bid to join and in order to pay back the loan, they like to remain a small group and with members they know well.

loans.use: purchase more primary materials like molds, flour, sugar and two chocolate fountains.

loans.name: Sharifjon

texts.ru:
Шарифчон предоставляет услугу. Он уже 7 лет как открыл мужскую парикмахерскую. Шарифчон хороший специалист. Ему 33 года. Он проживает в районе Хамадони. Шарифчон живет с женой. У него трое детей. 
Шарифчон берет кредит для покупки стройматериалов. Он хочет построить новое собственное помещение (парикмахерскую), чтобы продолжить и расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en:
Sharifjon works in the service sector. Seven years ago, he opened a barber shop. Sharifjon is a skilled specialist. He is 33 years old and lives in the Hamadoni region. He is married and has 3 children. 

Sharifon is seeking a loan in order to buy construction materials. He wants to build a new building (barbershop) of his own so that he can continue his business and expand it.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Paulinus

texts.en:
Paulinus is a 36-year-old man and is married to Ince, a 26-year-old lady. They have been blessed with a son, Patris, who is 5 years old and is attending
kindergarten. 

Paulinus owns a public minivan business. The business enables him to fulfill his family's needs as well as his child's schooling needs. Last month, his
van broke. Some of the parts of the van needed replacement. He did not have enough money to buy them so he came to TLM for help. He is requesting a 
Rp. 10,000,000 loan, which he would spend on purchasing a carburetor, tubes, machine oils, etc. for his van.

loans.use: to purchase a carburetor, tubes, machine oils, etc. for his minivan business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 58 years old and married with four children. Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 18 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, bread, and other groceries. 

In the future Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie is a 33-year old, married woman with 2 children living in Bunawan, Calamba. In order to add income to the family, she entered into a buying-and-selling of clothing business, which started 5 years ago. She usually gets PHP 8,000 per month. With the help of GDMPC microcredit, Rosalie will be able to buy more clothes to sell because of the money amounting PHP 10,000 rendered to her. She joined GDMPC this year. She hopes for much greater revenue someday for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Odalma Lisseth

texts.es:
Odalma, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para continuar invirtiendo en la compra de repuestos, por ejemplo necesita comprarse luces, bujillas, dos llantas, entre otros repuestos que son necesarios para mantener en orden y en adecuado uso el vehículo.
Con el préstamo anterior logro mejorar las condiciones del vehículo, espera que esto ayude a aumentar la vida útil del vehículo ya que su familia goza de viajar con ella y tambien le sirve hacia su empleo ya que aun permanece trabajando en la Alcaldia.
texts.en:
Odalma is asking for a new loan so that she can continue investing in repair parts, such as lights, spark plugs, two tires, among other things she needs to maintain her vehicle.

She was able to use the previous loan to improve the conditions of her vehicle and hopes to use this one to increase her vehicle’s useful life, since her family likes travelling with her.  It also helps her with her work with the city call.

loans.use: to buy repair parts.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El señor Guillermo desea realizar el mejoramiento a su vivienda cambiando el cableado eléctrico ya que esta en muy malas condiciones y puede ocasionar un accidente.
El señor Guillermo se dedica desde hace mas de dos años a la elaboración y venta de carbón y su esposa la señora Leticia lo apoya realizando trabajos de costuras. Ellos son originarios del estado de San Luis Potosí, tiene ya más de veinte años radicando en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. Con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio será para pagar el préstamo, ya que su esposa se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares de sus tres hijos que están estudiando la primaria.
texts.en:
Guillermo wants to do renovations to his house by changing the electrical wires that are in really bad condition and could cause an accident. 
For more than two years Guillermo has made and sold charcoal and his wife Leticia supports him doing sewing work.  They are originally from the state of San Luis Potosi and have lived in the city of Nuevo Laredo for more than 20 years.
He requests a loan to buy materials and pay the person that is going to do the renovations.  With the profits he makes he will repay the loan, his wife will take care of the family expenses and the education expenses of their children that are in elementary school.

loans.use: to change the electrical wiring of his house.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina tiene 39 años y trabaja en el sector de comercio, ella vende cosméticas, ropa, perfumes, platería y variedades,  directamente a sus clientes, que la conocen después de 4 años de experiencia con este negocio. Marina  está aplicando a un primer  crédiKiva para comprar en mayor volumen, cosméticos, perfumes, ropa interior y exterior, platería, desodorantes, lociones y muchas más mercancías. Este crédito es muy necesitado por Marina, porque uno de sus desafíos mayores en su productividad  es la ausencia de capital. Con este crédito, podrá tener mejor liquidez en su negocio, y así mismo ofrecer una mejor variedad   a sus clientes, aumentado las utilidades de su negocio y por consiguiente  sus ingresos. Marina vende directamente al consumidor final mediante créditos que su clientela paga en plazos cortos de acuerdo a su capacidad de pago, mientras sus compras las realiza de contado a grandes distribuidores que utilizan el sistema multinivel y guías especializadas a través de  las cuales Marina ofrece  sus productos a su clientela. Maria había recibido anteriormente un crédito de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual logró mejorar su liquidez  e incrementar un poco sus utilidades, por eso su nuevo credikiva se proyecta con un potencial exitoso.
texts.en: Marina is 39 years old and works in sales.  She sells cosmetics, clothes, perfume, silverware, and other items directly to her customers, who are familiar with Marina after 4 years of experience with this business.  Marina is applying for her first Kiva loan to buy cosmetics, perfumes, clothes and underwear, silverware, deodorant, lotions and many more products in greater quantity.  This loan is much needed for Marina because one of her greatest challenges in productivity is lack of capital.  With this loan, she she’ll have greater liquidity in her business and be able to offer her customers a better variety, thus increasing profits and by consequence, income.  Marina sells directly to her customers through credit that her customers pay in small amounts according to their ability to pay, while she makes her purchases in cash from big distributors who use the multilevel system and specialized guides through which Marina offers her products to her customers.  Marina has previously received a loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she was able to improve liquidity and increase profits a little, so she expects this new loan to be successful too.

loans.use: buy cosmetics, perfume, clothes and underwear, silverware, deodorants, lotions and many more products in greater quantity.

loans.name: William Alberto

texts.es:
William, está solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en su venta de pan, comprándose diariamente cierta cantidad a las panaderías de variedad de pan, con la intensión de tener surtido el negocio para los clientes.

El considera que estos prestamos le han permitido empezar el negocio con la venta de pan, y esta elaborandolo tambien para ganar clientes, poco a poco ira aumentando la producción para evitar comprarlo ya elaborado, en su familia comenta que todo a marchado bien.
texts.en:
William is asking for a loan to be able to invest in his bread business, buying a certain quantity and variety from bakeries so that he has a greater variety to offer his customers.

He considers these loans to have allowed him to start the business selling bread.  He is also baking it so that he can win new customers, and is increasing production little by little so that he doesn’t have to buy it.  He says that everything has gone well for his family.

loans.use: to buy bread.

loans.name: Heri

texts.en: Heri is 49 years old and married to Ernia, 59. He has a 25-year-old son who was graduated from Senior High school.  Heri operates a welding shop. The income generated from the business helps him meet his family needs. Heri wants to improve this business by adding more products and therefore he has requested a loan IDR 5,000,000 from TLM. Heri plans to spend the loan on putty, car paint, and sandpaper.

loans.use: to spend the loan on putty, car paint, and sandpaper.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 37 years old and married with three children.

Karen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like bread, soft-drinks, seasonings and other groceries.

Karen has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Karen aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bread, soft-drinks, seasonings amd other groceries.

loans.name: Melenia

texts.en:
Melenia works hard to support her family. She is married and has selling of used clothing business in the Philippines.

Melenia requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more used clothes, bags and other relief goods.

She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Melenia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes, bags and other relief goods.

loans.name: Visa Joy

texts.en: Visa Joy is 31 years old, married and the mother of 1 child. She lives in Swp, Calamba, where she has earned a living for the last 5 years by selling general merchandise/accessories. She makes PHP 15,000 a month and is applying for a loan for PHP 50,000 to obtain more accessories to sell. Recently, Visa Joy joined GDMPC as a way to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to obtain more accessories to sell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 35 years old and single.

Milagros is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Milagros requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

Milagros has been farming rice for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: Ingrid, tiene 33 años de edad y trabaja en la ciudad de Barranquilla vendiendo mercancía mediante guías especializadas de productos o catálogos a sus clientes. Ella compra ropa interior y exterior y va a sus vecinos y gente en su barrio directamente, para ofrecerlos y entre ellos distribuirlos mediante créditos pagados a plazos ajustados a sus posibilidades; Ella permanece trabajando todos los días por 10 horas, pues en condiciones de mujer separada de su esposo y con 2 hijos en las edades de 16 y 10 años, es  cabeza de su familia, y  tiene a su cargo la responsabilidad de su  hogar. Hace solamente 1 año empezó este negocio, por la necesidad de estar más cerca  a sus hijos, mientras generaba ingresos. En la actualidad Edith está solicitando un credikiva para poder comprar mas productos del catalogo de su oferta, para poder vender mas y así aumentar sus ingresos. Sus sueños son muy sencillos: generar crecimiento a su negocio para ganar más ingresos. Lo cual  servirá para alimentar el bienestar a su familia, cuidar sus hijos, e incrementar sus ahorros. Algún día Ingrid, como tanta gente en el mundo, quiere tener la oportunidad de comprar una casa propia. Aunque se encuentra con muchos desafíos en su vida, como el estar sola y tener la responsabilidad de sostenimiento de la casa y sus hijos, Ingrid sigue trabajando y ahorrando, y con la ayuda de Kiva esta mejorando la calidad de su vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Ingrid is 33 years old and works in the city of Barranquilla, selling merchandise through specialized catalogs or her client's catalogs. She purchases underwear and other clothing and goes to her neighbors directly to sell them merchandise and between them distribute paid credits in installments that can be adjusted to different situations. She works every day for 10 hours because she is separated from her husband and has two children who are 16 and 10 years old, making her the head of her household and so she has to be responsible for her home. It was only a year ago she started this business because she needed to be closer to her children but also earn an income. Today, Ingrid is asking for a loan in order to purchase more catalog products that she offers in order to sell more and increase her earnings. Her dreams are very simple: generate enough growth in her business in order to earn more. This will allow her to take care of the well being of her family, take care of her children and save more money. One day, Ingrid, like so many people in the world, wants to have an opportunity to buy her own house. Even though she finds herself facing many challenges in life, like being alone and having the responsibility of taking care of her house and children, Ingrid also continues working and saving and with the help of Kiva she is improving her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: purchase more catalog products that she offers.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo is 38 years old and lives with her vast family, which is made up of her eight children and her husband who also works. Mwanakombo has a fruit and vegetable stand in her home, in which she sells products like tomatoes, kales, potatoes, etc. She has many customers because she sells the fruits and vegetables at very good prices. It is for this reason that Mwanakombo requests a loan, with which she will be able to buy a bigger quantity of fruits and vegetables, since she wants to buy more in order to buy at lower prices and sell at even cheaper prices. This is of much importance for her since it allows her to receive better profits which benefit her family.

loans.use: to buy a bigger quantity of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Silvester

texts.en:
Sylvester is 38 years old a business man, he is married to Saran a business lady. They are blessed with four children. He has been running a green grocer business for the past one year with the monthly income of KES. 3,200 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan with KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET LTD staff member. Sylvester will use the loan to buy vegetables and fruits. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Amautas Cerro Kantica Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMAUTA CERRO KANTICA”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por doce integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Olga es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, costura de balones, venta de chicharrón, sahumerio, albañil, venta de flores, venta de frescos, venta de cosméticos , venta de pescado, venta de ropa interior, niñera.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Olga es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de refrescos; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió hace años aprendiendo al ver la necesidad de las personas que visitan el a los yatiris (persona que lee suerte en coca).
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de refrescos) que adquirirá de las camiones distribuidores y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijas.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.

En la fotografía no esta presente el señor Francisco, por razones culturales.
texts.en:
The community bank Amauta Cerro Kantica is starting their third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Pan-american loan center.  The group is made up of twelve members and is led by a board, including Olga, who is the president.  The members have different businesses, such as: selling food, sewing soccer balls, selling chicharrones, incense, bricklayer, selling flowers, selling soft drinks, selling cosmetics, selling fish, selling underwear, and being a nanny. 

The loan that they took out benefited small business owners where Olga was a member.  She said that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for three years.  She joined at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution.  Currently she has a business selling soft drinks.  She said that she learned this business years ago after seeing the need from the people who visit the yatiris (a person who reads luck in coca leaves).   

The loan they are taking now is to increase capital and purchase soft drinks.  She acquires them from distribution trucks and later sells them in her sales space.  This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family since she has a common-law marriage and has two daughters.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the health trainings and loans.  

Francisco is not present in the photograph for cultural reasons.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine for the embroidery business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and three go to school. She takes care of additional family members (brother). She sells charcoal at the market. She sells her products on retail basis. She has been in business for the last 4 years. She also gets additional income from selling piped water. She works seven days a week.  She has requested for a loan of Uganda shillings 500,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to build a house. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Ma.wilma

texts.en:
Ma. Wilma is 43 years old and married with two children.

Ma. Wilma is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Ma. Wilma requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and new tools for farming.

Ma. Wilma has been farming rice for 11 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and new tools for farming.

loans.name: Isabel Maria

texts.es: Isabel , 30 años, tiene un taller de confección de ropa. Ella vive en Barranquilla, con su hija de 3 años de edad.  Isabel siempre le interesaba el arte y el diseño, porque asistió a un colegio, que puso mucho énfasis en la confección y el diseño, ella empezó a trabajar en la confección de ropa hace 5 años, pero solo hasta hace  1 año,  tiene su propio taller y vende los vestidos de fiesta y ropa familiar que ella elabora,  directamente a los clientes. Un gran desafío para ella es que vive en un apartamento interno, así que su negocio no es visible, no obstante, su tarea es lograr darse a conocer por su clientela y esta es una de las motivaciones que tiene en su vida para crecer paulatinamente mediante financiamientos y lograr  aumentar sus ingresos para poder mudar su negocio a otro lugar, y mas adelante comprar una casa propia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un primer financiamiento Kiva en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos para la confección de ropa, en la línea de vestidos de coctel, matrimonio y ropa infantil. Si su negocio sigue creciendo, ella comprará maquinas y tendrá muchos empleados, tal como lo sueña.
texts.en: Isabel is 30 years old and has her own clothing workshop. She lives in Barranquilla with her three year old daughter. Isabel has always been interested in art and design because she went to a school that put a lot of emphasis on sewing and design. She began working making clothing 5 years ago but she has only had her own workshop for one year now and she sells party dresses and every day wear that she makes herself, directly to her customers. A particular challenge she faces in living in a inward facing apartment, which doesn't give visibility to her business, nevertheless, she works to make herself known to potential customers and this is one of the motivations she has in life, in order to gradually grow her business through financing and be able to increase her earnings in order to move her business to another location and also in the future purchase a house. She is currently applying for a loan, which is her first with Kiva and the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase primary materials and supplies for making clothing for cocktails events, weddings and baby clothing. If her business grows enough, she will purchase sewing machines and employ other people, which would be her dream.

loans.use: purchase prime materials and supplies to make clothing for cocktail events, weddings and baby clothes.

loans.name: Marta Rubidia

texts.es:
Marta, está solicitando un préstamo para poderse comprar productos de revistas y poder vender a los clientes, tambien invertirá una parte en la compra de ropa nueva, específicamente la inversión será en lociones, cremas, cosméticos, blusas, faldas, ropa interior, esto le dará una mejor apariencia al negocio con la nueva inversión.
Con el préstamo anterior logro tener mejor el negocio, con la inversión en los productos cosméticos, hasta el momento le ha permitido que sus clientes encuentren los cosméticos de su gusto, su situación ha mejorado y tiene el proyecto de iniciar la venta de ropa nueva.
texts.en: Marta is asking for a loan in order to purchase products such as magazines and to be able to sell more to her customers, she will also invest a portion of the loan to purchase new clothing, but specifically the loan will be for lotions, creams, cosmetics, blouses, skirts and underwear, this will give her business a better appearance. With the previous loan she was able to improve her business by investing in cosmetics, which until this moment has allowed her clients to find more make up to their taste and so her situation has improved and she has a project to start selling new clothing.

loans.use: purchase lotions, creams, cosmetics, blouses, skirts and underwear.

loans.name: Ma. Edwina

texts.en:
Ma. Edwina is 39 years old and married with 4 children.  With 3 children in school, Ma. Edwina works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Edwina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell.

Ma. Edwina has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, snack foods and other grocery items. 

In the future Ma. Edwina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HORMIGUITAS”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Wilma es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio de chicharrón, venta de queso y carne, venta de cosméticos, tienda de barrio, costura de prendas de vestir, costura de ropa deportiva.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Wilma es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa.  En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que instaló al ver el requerimiento de los vecinos de su zona.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de azúcar, enlatados, aceite, etc.) que adquirirá de las vendedoras por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene una hija.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio.
texts.en:
The Hormiguitas group will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Panamericana.  It is comprised of six members and is directed by a board led by Wilma as president.  The members of the communal group have various businesses.  Among them we have a trade in pork, cheese and meat sales, selling cosmetics, a neighborhood store, apparel sewing, and sportswear sewing.
The loan they take out will benefit the microentrepreneurs of which Wilma is a member.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer by invitation two years ago when a friend who is a member of the institution came to visit her at her home.  
Now she has her own business of a neighborhood store, which she started after recognizing the needs of her neighbors.  The loan she will take out now is to increase capital (to buy sugar, canned goods, oils, etc.) which she will acquire from wholesale sellers and sell in her retail space.
This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she lives in union and has a daughter.  
When you ask her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the office.

loans.use: buy sugar, canned goods, oils, etc.

loans.name: Ana Carolina

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer joven de 23 años, es soltera y culminó sus estudios secundarios. Vive en la ciudad de El Puyo, cantón capital de la Provincia de Pastaza, una provincia que forma parte importante de la Región Amazónica del Ecuador, siendo el centro de la selva amazónica. En su capital Puyo se puede gozar de un agradable clima y un paisaje esplendoroso con ríos, cascadas diversidad de fauna y flora por lo que turistas nacionales y extranjeros llegan a deleitarse de estos cálidos atractivos. Por ser el turismo una de las actividades económicas más importantes, en el centro de la ciudad se encuentra fácilmente todos los servicios para acoger al turista como son hoteles, hosterías, restaurantes, instituciones financieras, etc. También los habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería que son favorecidas con la tierra fértil que posee este lugar. Sin duda El Puyo es una ciudad que vale la pena visitar ya que ha crecido mucho en los últimos años por el espíritu emprendedor y trabajador de su gente. 
Ana se ha dedicado a la venta de cosméticos y productos naturales dedicados a cuidar la salud, actividad que aprendió de sus parientes y lo inició hace 2 años en los cuales sus clientes han incrementado, ya que la asesoría personalizada que Ana brinda para que sus clientes se vean y se sientan  mejor es el valor agregado que ha hecho que este negocio incremente. Al recibir mayores descuentos por un mayor volumen de pedidos, ella requiere un préstamo para adquirir productos y mantener stock con los productos más demandados por sus clientes. Ana espera de esta forma incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 23 years old, single, and finished high school.  She lives in the city of El Puyo, the canton capital of the Pastaza province, which forms an important part of the Amazon region in Ecuador, which is in the center of the Amazonian jungle.  In Puyo, Ecuadorians and foreign tourists come to enjoy an agreeable climate and splendid landscape with rivers, waterfalls, and a diversity of plants and animals.  Because tourism is one of the most important economic activities, the center of the city has all of the services to accommodate tourists such as hotels, hostels, restaurants, banks, and others.  The inhabitants also work in agriculture and raising livestock, which are favored because of the fertile land in the area.  Without a doubt, El Puyo is a city that is worth visiting since it has grown a lot in the last few years because of the enterprising spirit and hard work of the local people.  

Ana works selling cosmetics and natural healthcare products. She learned this work from her relatives and started her own business two years ago.  Her customers have increased since she provides personalized advice so that her customers look and feel better.  This added value has made her business increase.  To receive bigger discounts for a larger volume of orders, she requires a loan to acquire products and maintain stock of the most popular products.  Ana hopes that this will increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase products and increase her stock.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store.

NWTF is relisting Natividad's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married mother of 3 children, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from local eatery.  Nenita is borrowing PHP 19500 through NWTF to purchase more items such biscuits, bread, soft-drinks and other groceries for her general store business.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items such biscuits, bread, soft-drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Nellyn

texts.en:
Nellyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Nellyn requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

She has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Nellyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married mother of 3 children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Rowena is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of rice to sell.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Sherly requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

She has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Sherly would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Aida works hard to support her family.

She has a meat vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport and raising cows. Aida is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to purchase meat to sell for her meat vending business.

Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase meat to sell

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 33-year-old married woman who lives in Lahore with her husband and children. She has been in the business of making bags for many years. She makes school bags at home and sells them in her community. She has a good client list, as most of her clients are her neighbors. Her work is much appreciated among her customers. 

She is a loving mother of four children and responsible for providing them with the basic necessities of life. Yasmeen wishes to send her children to school and save for her daughter’s dowry. So she needs to expand her current work by bringing in more machines as well as material. At present she has requested from Kashf a loan for 15,000 PKR to finance the cost of purchasing raw material such as bundles of cloth, zippers and leather. She hopes to earn profits and intends to utilize them on the betterment of her children.

loans.use: To buy bundles of cloth, zippers and leather.

loans.name: Merceditas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MERCEDITAS”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: costura de camisetas, tejido de chompas, venta de queso, costura y venta de polleras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lidia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa.  En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de chompas que aprendió de su madre que tiene negocio en este rubro, posteriormente ella copio este negocio con un poco de capital que tenía.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las vendedoras por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijas.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito porque les explican detalladamente las cosas
texts.en:
The community bank Merceditas is starting their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II loan center.  The group is made up of six members and is led by a board, with Lidia as the president.  The members have a variety of businesses, including sewing shirts, knitting sweaters, selling cheese, sewing and selling skirts.  

The loan they are taking benefits small business owners such as Lidia.  She said that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years.  She joined at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution when she visited her at home.  Currently she has a business knitting sweaters.  She learned this work from her mother who has a business doing this as well.  She copied this business and started her own with the small amount of capital that she had.  

The loan they are taking now is to increase capital and purchase wool, which she will acquire from wholesale vendors and later she will make sweaters and sell them in her sales space.  This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family since she is married and has two daughters.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the health and financial trainings because they provide detailed explanations for things.

loans.use: to purchase wool.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 53 years old and widowed with 2 children.

Sarah works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Sarah has been in this business for 21 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Sarah aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 51 years old and a widowed mother with three children. Concepcion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell. Concepcion has been in this business for 23 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Concepcion aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie works hard to support her family. She is single and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Virgie requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like biscuits, candies, and other miscellaneous items.

She has been in this business for a year.

In the future, Virgie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like biscuits, candies, and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 38 years old and married, with six children. She runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and works hard to provide for her family. 

Alma has requested a loand of 17,500 PHP through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. She has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal retail business for three years and also earns an income from selling rice.

Alma aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is 54 years old and married, with six children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for 34 years and also earns additional income from selling dried coconut meat and raising pigs.

Eulalia is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is married and works hard to support her family. She has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. Avelina has been in this business for five years.

Avelina has requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell. In the future, Avelina would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a meat vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years. Leticia earns more income from rice retail and raising pigs. She is borrowing 28,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional meat to sell for her meat vending business.

Leticia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional meat to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet works hard to support her family. She is married and has a Fish vending business in the Philippines.

Juliet requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Juliet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

*This picture was taken during market day and Juliet is wearing black t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle, which he uses to provide transport service.

loans.name: Mujeres De Chocruz Group

texts.es:
La señora Margarita esta casada, tiene 37 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene  8 hijos, 4 de los cuales estudian, se dedica a los oficios domestico, como también a la elaboración de canastas de plástico, inicio este negocio, gracias al poyo de su padres, hasta el momento lleva 15 años de experiencia, cuenta con al apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizaran para la compra de materia 
para la elaboración de canastas de platico, las cuales son vendidas a diferentes personas, el dinero sera utilizado para comprad plástico, para base, tejido y terminación de las canastas, espera ene el futuro tener un punto de venta de canastas. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la elaboración. Una de las integrante4s de la fotos no califico para el préstamo.
texts.en:
Margarita is 37 years old, married, and did not have the opportunity to attend school.  She has eight children, four of whom are in school.  She takes care of her home and also works making plastic baskets.  She started this business thanks to the support of her parents.  At this time, she has 15 years of experience and has the support of her husband who works in trade.  

She organized a group to request a loan that she will use to purchase materials to make plastic baskets.  They are sold to different people.  The money will be used to purchase plastic for the base and fabric to finish the baskets.  She hopes that in the future she will have a shop to sell the baskets.  The other members of the group are dedicated to production.  One of the members in the photo is not participating in the loan.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make baskets.

loans.name: Dos De Mayo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “DOS DE MAYO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Eusebia ella es soltera y tiene 40 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de leña,las ocia vende leña en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia tambien se dedica al negocio de venta de frutas y verduras como tomates,zanahorias,cebollas,manzanas,platanos,naranjas y uvas,la socia las frutas y verduras lo vende en el mercado,por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas,verduras y leña. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar frutas y verduras como manzanas,mandarinas,uvas y platanos y tambien cebollas,zanahorias y tomates al por mayor.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal,se les tomo despues la foto porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo. 
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de restaurant y negocio de fotografias.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "Dos de Mayo" They are located in the Cusco district, part of the Cusco province and Cusco region.

The member, Eusebia, is 40, single and has two children. She works as travelling firewood salesperson and works from 8am to 6pm. She also has a business selling fruit and vegetables, such as tomatoes, carrots, onions, apples, bananas, oranges and grapes. She sells the fruit and vegetables at the market.

These businesses are the member's way of supporting her children. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell the fruit, vegetables and firewood. The member is requesting this loan so she can buy wholesale fruit and vegetables like apples, mandarins, grapes and bananas as well as onions, carrots and tomatoes.

The members whose pictures are stuck to the group photo, had their photos taken later because of their work commitments.

The other members have various trades such as a grocery store, clothes store, restaurant and photography business.
 
The member is grateful to those who are helping towards her dream in this way and is committed to making payments according to the agreed schedule.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fruits and vegetables, such as apples, mandarins, grapes and bananas as well as onions, carrots and tomatoes.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Melba works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending and raising pigs. Melba is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Melba has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production

loans.name: Dulcisima

texts.en:
Dulcisima is 64 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for them. Dulcisima runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy grocery items to sell in her store. Dulcisima has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future, Dulcisima would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita is 51 years old, married and has 7 children, 4 are in school.

Alita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Alita has been pig fattening for 6 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Alita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a variety store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more grocery items like soft drinks, biscuits and other groceries.

NWTF is re-listing Elenita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items like soft drinks, biscuits and other groceries.

loans.name: Armida

texts.en:
Armida works hard to support her family. Armida is married and has a buying and selling of rice business in the Philippines.

Armida requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

Armida has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Armida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice to sell

loans.name: Mwaniki

texts.en:
Mwaniki has been running a retail shop as a primary business and is a mixed crop farmer as a secondary business for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES. 11,000 which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his second loan  from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. 

Mwaniki will use the loan to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, seedlings and fertilizer. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children.

He hopes to buy a piece of land and build rental houses one day.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 43 years old and married with 2 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Edith runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks for her general store.

Edith has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as egg, noodles, canned goods, soap, sugar, etc.

In the future Edith would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for her general store

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a dedicated woman who likes her job because she knows that it is where her daily bread comes from. She continues operating her food stall and she has counted good results. Fatuma needs to invest more in her business for her to continue progressing. Her goal is to see her children become professionals. The loan she is requesting will help her to buy beans, flour and cooking oil, and also renovate the business premise. She hopes to earn more profits out of this investment.

loans.use: to buy beans, flour and cooking oil, and also to renovate the business premise

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 24-year-old mixed crop farmer. He is married to Elizabeth, a farmer. They are blessed with one child. He has been in the farming business for the past 6 years, with a monthly income of 20,000 KES which he uses to support his family. 

Michael is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Michael will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his child. His hope and dream is to expand the farming business by buying another farm.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Carlos y su esposo tienen tres hijas de edad escolar y son originarios de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo.
El señor Carlos es empleado de una tienda de muebles para el hogar en el aria de vendedor y su esposo tiene un negocio de papelería escolar ubicada en el domicilio, son los ingresos que tiene para salir adelante.
Están solicitando un préstamo para realizar los acabados del exterior de la casa y también cambiar la fachado del negocio, que le esta haciendo falta. 
Desean mejorar los ingresos y que el patrimonio de la familia este en mejores condiciones.
Con el sueldo que recibe el señor Carlos será para pagar el crédito, ya que con las ganancias que se obtiene del negocio será para los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Carlos and his wife have three school aged children and are from the city of Nuevo Laredo.

Carlos is an employee at a home furniture store as a salesman and his wife has a stationary store located in their home, they use these incomes to get ahead.

They are asking for this loan to put the finishing touches on the exterior of their home and also to change the shop frontage, which is lacking.

They would like to improve their income and for their family home to be in better condition.

Carlos' wages will be used to pay the loan as the income from the business will be used to pay household expenses.

loans.use: to add the finishing touches to the outside of his home.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel has been in the farming business for the past four years and has a monthly income of KES 12,000, which he uses to support his family members. He is applying for his second loan term with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Samuel will use the loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profits from the business, he will educate his children. He hopes to buy a piece of land and build rental houses, which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance on his motorcycle

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell for her vegetable selling business. Elma has been in this business for three years. Elma earns additional income from livestock. Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients in making viand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Margarita Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Margarita Catalina,   es una persona  emprendedora, labora diario desde las seis de la mañana hasta las cuatro de la tarde, los siete días de la semana, en su negocio venta de gaseosas y jugos, en uno de los mercados de la capital, tiene mas de 10 años de dedicarse a esa actividad.

 Solicita el  préstamo a nuestra institución para invertirlo en su negocio en la compra de gaseosas, jugos y golosinas. Esto con el propósito de comprar más productos,  y de esta forma ofrecer  variedad a sus clientes y captar mas compradores. El crédito anterior lo invirtió en productos y de esta forma ha incrementado su negocio.

  Agradece  a  ceprodel y Kiva, por la oportunidad y la confianza depositada en ella, y  esto le permitirá llevar el sustento a su hogar  e ir mejorando su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Margarita Catalina is an enterprising person who works every day from 6:00am until 4:00pm at her business selling sodas and juices at one of the markets in the capital.  She has more than ten years of experience doing this work.

She is asking for a loan from this institution to invest in her business by purchasing sodas, juices, and sweets.  She plans to purchase more products so that she can offer more variety to her customers and make more sales.  She invested a previous loan in products as well and in this way she is growing her business.

She is grateful to Ceprodel and Kiva for the opportunity and the confidence they have in her.  This will allow her to provide support to her household and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase sodas, juices, and sweets.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is from Tianeti district of East Georgia. He is 25 years old and lives with his wife, two children (4 and 5 years old), parents and two sisters. His elder sister works as a shop assistant and gets a monthly income. David runs a small dairy business; he has 4 milk cows and a calf. His mother milks the cows and produces cheese products. In addition, David has a truck and a tractor. He serves to the local farmers with his tractor and gets a service fee. David also offers them delivery service. He is a very hardworking young man, with a great desire to get ahead.

David requested a loan to purchase calves. He plans to raise, fatten and sell them at a good price. After a year, the family will be able to get a profit. The received profit will be reinvested in the family agricultural business. David will expand his animal husbandry business and will be able to get an increased income. All members of the family will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Elsie works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from firewood and charcoal retail. Elsie is borrowing 26,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients

loans.name: Kinyua

texts.en:
Kinyua is a 59-year-old businessman. He is widowed with two children. He has been selling construction materials for the past 15 years, with a monthly income of 10,600 KES which he uses to support his family. 

Kinyua is applying for his first loan with KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET LTD staff member. He will use the loan to buy sand and stones. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hope and dream is to buy a brick-making machine.

loans.use: to buy sand and stones

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 50 years old and married with 3 children who are in school. Lorna works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store. Lorna has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, sugar, eggs, spices, etc.. 

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Lucia works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. 

Lucia is borrowing 27,000 PHP  through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle transport business. Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her three children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Blanca Yesenia

texts.es: Blanca Yesenia de treinta y uno años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida Antonio y sus dos hijos; ella posee un comedor en el mercado de la localidad donde reside es muy conocida y tiene varios años de experiencia en la cocina que le permite realizar los mejores platillos, carne, pollo, ensaladas, sopas, pastas, entre otros , se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque  todo lo que vende es elaborado con material de primera calidad, es higiénico, con precios accesibles pero sobre todo con un excelente servicio; Blanca es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su labor, siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito no descansara hasta lograr un futuro mas prospero, como toda buena comerciante quiere realizar una nueva inversión para mejorar su negocio, pero no posee del capital suficiente por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita costear la reparación de refrigerador, comprar de mesas y materia prima para la comida. Blanca Yesenia tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza de llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Blanca Yesenia, 31, lives with her partner Antonio and her two children. 

She runs a diner in the market in her town, she is very well-known and has several years experience in the kitchen, which allows her to prepare the best disches: meat, chicken, salads, soups, pastas and other things. She has built up a good customer base since people like her because all her food is made of top quality ingredients as well as being hygienic and sold at accessible prices, but above all because of the excellent service.

Blanca is an enterprising woman and dedicated to her work. She is always looking for new opportunities that will allow her to achieve success and will not tire until she reaches a more prosperous future. 

Like any good trader, she wants to invest to improve her business, but she does not have enough capital, which is why she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will let her cover the cost of repairing the fridge, buy tables and raw materials for the food.

Blanca Yesenia has good payment references and is sure she can pay off the debt and at the same time hopes to improve her household economic security.

loans.use: to repair the fridge, buy tables and basic ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Pilagia

texts.en:
Pelagia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a variety store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more grocery products to sell.

NWTF is re-listing Pelagia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling frozen products in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 7 years. Monina earns more income from food vending and a general store.

Monina is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her frozen products business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es: Wilson con su anterior credikiva compró cervezas, gaseosas, dulces y jugos con los que surtió su pequeño exhibidor, y también invirtió en resmas de papel y tinta. Su nuevo crédito lo invertirá en un mayor volumen de papelería galletería y duces, para continuar atendiendo a su clientela por la cual se desvive y en esto radica el éxito de su credikiva. En su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva Wilson dice : “Muchas gracias por darme la oportunidad de beneficiarme con un crédito con ustedes, espero sigan confiando en mi y me permitan recibir un nuevo credikiva“.
texts.en: With his previous Kiva loan, Wilson bought beers, soft drinks, sweets and fruits juices with which to stock his small stand, as well as investing in reams of paper and ink. He will invest his new loan in a greater volume of stationary, biscuits and sweets to continue to attend to his customers for whom he does his utmost, and therein lies the success of his Kiva loan. His message to the Kiva loan lenders: "Thank you so much for giving me the opportunity to obtain a loan from yourselves. I hope that you continue to trust me and that you allow me to access a new Kiva loan.”

loans.use: to invest in a larger volume of stationary, biscuits and sweets.

loans.name: Yurleida
