texts.es: Yuleida compró materias primas e incumos conlos que elaboró muchos productos que vendió rapidaente; su clientela se ha incrmetado y en la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevoc redikiva, con el cual comprará una máquina colarina, industrial, con ella podrá fabricar prendas de vestir, dobleces, pegar cuellos y mejorará los tiempos productivos en su taller y daría un mejor acabado a sus prendas, auumentando a su vez la calidad del producto. Ella envia el siguiente mensaje a los fianciadores deKiVA: "Estoy muy contenta con el apoyo, que he recibido; mi negocio sigue adelante y le agradezco muchisimo su ayuda para prosperar y mejorar las condiciones de mi taller. "
texts.en:
Yurleida bought raw materials and supplies and with them she made many products which sold quickly, her customer base has grown and now she is applying for a new Kiva loan, which she will use to buy an industrial sewing machine.

With the machine she will be able to make garments, pleats, attach collars and improve the production time in her workshop. It would give her garments a better finish and raise their quality.

She sends the following message to Kiva loan givers: "I am very happy with the support that I have received; my business is continuing to grow  and I am very grateful for your help to prosper and to improve the conditions in my factory."

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 49 years old and married, with two children.

Ann works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like snack foods, groceries to sell in her store.

Ann has been in this business for four years, and she has previously received funds through Kiva.

Ann aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like snack foods and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es:
La señora Maria de la Cruz,  vive  en la bella capital donde labora a diario desde las seis de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde, los seis días de la semana, en su negocio venta de comida, ella trabaja junto a su esposo en el negocio, ambos son trabajadores, ella  realiza la preparación de los alimentos  y el esposo sale a entregar la comida a sus clientes que trabajan en empresas ubicadas cerca de su negocio.

 Solicita el  préstamo a nuestra institución para invertir en capital de trabajo, ella comprara   arroz,carne, verduras. Esto con el propósito de abastecer y obtener mas variedad de platos y lograr así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y captar mas compradores. 

 Agradece  a  ceprodel y Kiva, por la oportunidad y la confianza depositada en ella, por lo que este crédito lo invertirá en su negocio  de forma que esto le permitirá llevar el sustento a su hogar  e ir mejorando su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Maria de la Cruz lives in the beautiful capital city where she works at her food sales business from six in the morning until three in the afternoon, six days a week. She works with her husband in this business, and they are both hardworking. She prepares the food and her husband delivers it to their customers who work for companies located near their business.

She is requesting the loan from our institution in order to invest in working capital. She will buy rice, meat, and vegetables, with the intention of supplying her business and also obtaining a greater variety of dishes. In this way she will satisfy the demand from her customers and attract more buyers.

She is grateful to Ceprodel and Kiva for the opportunity and confidence they've given her, so she will invest this loan in her business in a way that will allow her to carry the support to her home and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, and vegetables in order to prepare delicious meals.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 65 years old and married, with six children. 

Rosalia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosalia has been raising pigs for 25 years now.  In the past, she has borrowed 18 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosalia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family.  She is married, and she has a recycled materials business in the Philippines.

Lorna has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy recycled materials to sell.

Lorna has been in this business for five years now.  She also earns additional income from raising pigs.

In the future, Lorna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Maria Guidella

texts.en:
Maria Guidella is 53 years old and married, with five children.

Maria Guidella works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like bread, soft drinks and other goods.

Maria Guidella has been in this business for 13 years, and she has previously received funds through Kiva.

Maria Guidella aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like bread, soft drinks, and other goods.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa works hard to support her family. She is single, and she has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Theresa has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

She has been in this business for seven years.

In the future, Theresa  would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Maura Liseth

texts.es: Maura Liseth de treinta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a sus tres hijos con edades de trece, doce y cinco años; ella se dedica a la venta de fruta de forma ambulante mango, fresas,  jocotes,  guayaba entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas, es muy conocida en las zonas donde vende y se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque es muy confiable además de que todo lo que comercia de es primera calidad, a buenos precios y con un servicio excelente; Maura es una mujer dedicada a su labor, activa y muy emprendedora tiene ganas de salir adelante y ganarse un futuro mas prospero, se esfuerza día a día para lograr ese éxito, como toda buena comerciante ahora que aumento la demanda quiere aprovechar para aumentar la inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mango, fresas, jocotes, mamones, guayaba, etc. Maura tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, asegura que se hará responsable de cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Maura Liseth is 34 years old and lives with her three children who are 5, 12, and 13 years old.  She works selling fruit such as mango, strawberries, plums, guava, and more as a street vendor. She has done this work for many years and this has given her a lot of experience with sales.  She is very well known in the areas where she sells and she has a large customer base since people prefer her because she is very trustworthy and all of her produce is of good quality at good prices and with excellent service.  

Maura is very dedicated to her work.  She is active, very enterprising, and wants to get ahead and have a more prosperous future.  She works hard every day to achieve this success.  Like all good businesspeople, she wants to take advantage of increased demand with a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to purchase mango, strawberries, plums, papaya, and guava.  Maura has good payment references from people that know her.  She promises she will repay her debt in the time allotted and at the same time be able to bring financial security to her household.

loans.use: to purchase mango, strawberries, plums, papaya, and guava.

loans.name: Carmen Jacqueline

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Productivo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora Carmen tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 19, 17 y 13 años, el mayor estudia en universidad y los menores en colegio. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella tiene una tienda en su casa, allí vende productos de primera necesidad, artículos de bazar y productos de Avon, Lebel y Saysons (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días desde las 07h00 hasta las 21h00, sus hijos le ayudan en su labor cuando ellos están desocupados. Tiene cinco años con su negocio y le va muy bien ya que cada vez tiene más clientes y esto es porque en su local  sus clientes pueden encontrar de todo.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, otros productos de primera necesidad y cosméticos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en: The "Productivo" communal bank meets every two weeks in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and artisanry, which is known at the national and international level.  It is famous for its Panama hats.  Señora Carmen is 42 and married.  She has three children, who are 19, 17, and 13.  The oldest is in college and the youngest ones are in high school.  Her husband is a driver.  She has a store in her home, where she sells basic goods; miscellaneous items; and Avon, Lebel, and Saysons products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories).  She works every day from 7 a.m. until 9 p.m.  Her children help her with her work when they aren't busy.  She has had her business for five years, and it is going well for her.  She has more customers all the time, and this is because they can find everything at her store.  She will use this loan to stock her store.  She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, other basic goods, and cosmetics.  She has been part of her communal bank since it started, and she likes it because the group is very united.  Her goals are to get ahead with her business and to grow her store more every day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, other basic goods, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Productivo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora Rosa tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco  hijos de 21, 19, 17, 12 y 7 años de edad, cuatro de ellos aun viven en su casa y estudian en universidad, colegio y escuela. El marido es operador de maquinaria pesada.
 
Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a sus hijos con los gastos que generan sus estudios se dedica a la venta de ropa, productos naturales y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es informal o puerta a puerta y trabaja cuatro días a la semana de dos a tres horas al dia ya que es un trabajo que no tiene horario fijo, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 4 años que se dedica a  este tipo de ventas y le va muy bien.

Está repitiendo el crédito ya que el anterior como todos los que ha recibido le han ayudado para solventar los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos ya que para ella es lo más importe, este crédito es para comprar ropa, productos naturales,  perfumes, cremas, cosméticos entre otras cosas. Lleva 5 ciclos  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean muy buenos profesionales ya que por esos lucha dia a dia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Productivo" meets every fifteen days in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and handicrafts, which are known on a national and international level. This is home to the famous 'Panama hat.'

Rosa is 38 years old and lives in a common-law marriage from which she has five children, ages 21, 19, 17, 12, and 7. Four of them still live at home and study at university, high school, and elementary school. Her husband is a heavy machinery operator.

She is a housewife who sells clothing, natural products, and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories) in order to have her own resources and be able to help her children with the cost of their studies. Her sales method is informal or door to door, and she works four days per week, around two or three hours per day. Her work doesn't have a set schedule; she leaves her products with her customers on credit and collects payments every eight days. She's been doing this type of sales work for four years and it suits her very well.

She's requesting another loan since the previous one, like all the loans she's received, have helped her pay for the cost of her children's studies, which for her is the most important thing. This loan is to buy clothing, natural products, perfumes, creams, and cosmetics, among other things. She's had five loan cycles with the communal bank and she likes it because the payments are easy to make.

Her dream is that her children become very good professionals since she fights for them day after day.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, natural products, perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Antonio Paredez Candia Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ANTONIO PAREDES CANDIA”  iniciará el ciclo decimo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Magdalena es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: costura de enaguas, venta frescos y galletas, venta de comida, venta de queques, venta de mantas, repostería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Magdalena es integrante, ella indica que hace un año y medio que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su comadre que es socia de la institución.  En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de mantas que trabaja hace años atrás, aprendiendo esta actividades de su suegra.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las vendedoras por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Antonio Paredes Candia" is starting its thirteenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the regional group Panamericana. The bank is made up of 7 members and is headed by a board of directors, with Magdalena as director. The members' business are varied and include sewing petticoats, selling fresh goods and biscuits, food sales, cake sales, blanket sales and confectionary.

The loan will benefit various small microbusinesses where Magdalena is a member. She indicates that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for a year and a half, joining by invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. She currently has a business sewing and selling blankets, a trade she has worked in for years having learnt from her mother-in-law.

The loan that she is now taking out is to raise her capital (to buy wool) that she will get from wholesalers and later she will make and sell them in her sales location.

This type of work allows her to generate an income to support her family as she lives with a partner and has three children.

When she asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training in finance and health.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 44 years old and married, with two school-age children. 

She owns and manages a variety store in their community to supplement her husband's income.  Because of the high cost of commodities and school fees, she needs to increase her income to satisfy her family's necessities and finance the education of her children. 

She planned to improve her business by acquiring more stocks of grocery items to sell.  For lack of capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy junk foods, beverages, eggs, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, and seasonings to sell. 

She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to increase her product offerings and satisfy her customers' demand. She hopes that someday, she will make her business grow and become profitable.

loans.use: to buy junk foods, beverages, eggs, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Santo Thony

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Productivo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

El señor Santo tiene 48 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 22 y 21 años los mismos que estudian en universidad. La esposa es ama de casa y le ayuda en su trabajo.

Él tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz y su especialidad es parte electrónica y computarizada de los automóviles, tiene muchos clientes que llegan hasta su taller para que les realice sus trabajos ya que no hay muchos técnicos que arreglan este tipo de daños en los vehículos. Su esposa le ayuda en su trabajo al igual que sus hijos cuando ellos pueden, lleva con su taller por más de 5 años el cual lo tiene en un local alquilado. Allí también el vende ciertos repuestos eléctricos ya que le facilita el trabajo y además se gana algo extra.

Está repitiendo el crédito en el Banco ya que el otro crédito le fue de mucha ayuda pues compró varios productos que necesitaba para mejorar su taller, con las ganancias que obtuvo pudo solventar los gastos del hogar y también compro ciertas herramientas que necesitaba para su trabajo, este crédito es para comprar más repuestos eléctricos para vehículos para surtir su negocio.  Este es el sexto  ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son tener un local propio para no pagar arriendos.
texts.en:
The communal bank, "Productivo," meets every two weeks in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial agriculture and its artisanry, which is known at the national and international level.  It is also famous for its Panama hats.

Señor Santo is 48 and is in a common law marriage.  He has two children, who are 22 and 21.  They study in college.  His wife is a housewife and helps him with his job.

He has an auto shop, and his speciality is electronic and computerized parts for cars.  Many customers come to his shop so he can do work.  There aren't many technicians who can fix this type of damage in vehicles.  He wife helps him with his work, and his children also help when they can.  He has had his shop for more than five years in a rented location.  He also sells certain electronic spare parts since his job makes it easy to do and he can earn extra income.

He is asking for another loan from his communal bank.  He other loan helped him a lot because he bought various products that he was needing to improve his shop.  With the profits, he could pay for some home expenses and also buy tools that he needed.  He will use this loan to buy more electronic spare parts to stock his business.  This is his sixth loan with his communal bank, and he likes the help that he receives through his loans.

His dream is to have his own location so he does not have to pay rent.

loans.use: to purchase electrical spare parts for vehicles.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge Alberto de cincuenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos; él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol y sorgo, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le regalado mucha experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas; el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola apto para la siembra, toda la producción la comercia en los alrededores de la zona donde reside y ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y con un excelente servicio; Jorge es un hombre dedicado a su labor, activo y muy luchador todos los días se levanta con la esperanza de ganarse un futuro mas prospero, se esfuerza al máximo sabe que solo así alcanzara el éxito; en la ultima cosecha sufrió perdidas y quiere recuperarse pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, sorgo, insecticida, abono, etc. Jorge Alberto tiene buenas referencias de pago es muy responsable asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dará a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto is 53 years old and lives with his life partner and their children.  He works cultivating corn, beans, and sorghum.  He has worked in agriculture for many years and that has given him a lot of valuable experience that allows him to have better harvests.  The land that he cultivates is located in an area with a high incidence of agriculture because it is good for planting.  He sells his harvest in the areas around where he lives and he has many customers who prefer him because everything he sells is of the best quality at accessible prices and with excellent service.

Jorge is very dedicated to his work.  He is active and a fighter.  Every day he wakes up with the hope of having a more prosperous future.  He makes the maximum effort because he knows that is the only way to success.  In his last harvest he suffered losses and he wants to recover them, but he does not have sufficient capital, so he requested a loan from INTEGRAL to purchase corn seeds, beans, sorghum, insecticide, and fertilizer. Jorge Alberto has good payment references.  He is very responsible and promises he will be able to repay his debt and at the same time has faith that he will give his family a full life.

loans.use: to purchase corn seeds, beans, sorghum, insecticide, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Octavio Edmundo

texts.es:
Octavio, 50 años de edad se dedica a reparar refrigeradoras, frízer, habita en la ciudad de Estelí , padre de 4 hijos . En los años 90 él se fue a E.E.U.U y trabajo en construcción .Durante el día laboraba como obrero y en  la noche estudiaba un curso de técnico en  refrigeración. Después de tres años regreso al país con la idea de emprender su propio negocio de reparación de frízer y refrigeradoras. Gracias a esta actividad mantiene a su familia, les da educación a sus hijos. 
Él está requiriendo financiamiento para comprar repuestos tales como refrigerantes, varillas, timer. Su expectativa es mejorar los inventarios de repuestos así como mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio para ofrecerles a sus clientes calidad y buen servicio.
texts.en:
Octavio is fifty years old and works repairing refrigerators and freezers. He lives in the city of Esteli and is the father of four children. In the nineties he went to the United States and worked in construction. During the day he was a worker and at night he studied a technical course on refrigeration. After three years he returned to his country with the idea of starting his own refrigerator and freezer repair business. Thanks to this work he supports his family and gives an education to his children.

Right now he needs financing to buy spare parts such as refrigerants, rods, and timers. His expectation is that he'll improve his inventory of spare parts and thereby improve the infrastructure of his business in order to offer his customers quality and good service.

loans.use: to buy spare parts such as refrigerants, rods, and timers.

loans.name: Qorichaskas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORICHASKAS”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Antonia ella es casada y tiene 62 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche,golosinas,gaseosas,entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia trabaja en su negocio de lunes a domingo desde las 06:00am hasta las 09:00pm aproximadamente aunque este horario puede variar de acuerdo a las actividades que pueda tener en el dia,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como arroz y leche para su negocio.

Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, cabinas de internet, venta de calzados, venta de productos como  granos secos y profesionales como enfermera y odontóloga.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "Quorichaskas." This bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.

The member named Antonia is sixty-two years old, married, and has three children. She mixes her daily activities with the business of having a general store. She sells different types of products such as rice, sugar, milk, candy, and sodas, among other things. She has been in this business for years and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts in every day. She works from Monday to Sunday from six in the morning until approximately nine at night, though this schedule can vary depending on the activities she may have during the day. She is a responsible and diligent person, and by being this way she's gotten her family ahead.

She's asking for the loan to buy merchandise such as rice and milk for her business.

The other members work at businesses such as clothing sales, internet booths, shoe sales, and selling grains, and also include professionals such as a nurse and a dentist.

She is grateful to all those who are part of this dream in this way, and she is committed to making her payments in the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice and milk for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 39-year-old businesswoman who is married to Christopher, a businessman. They are blessed with four children. 

She has been running a green grocery for the past 13 years and earns a monthly income of 17000 KES, which she uses to support her family. 

Joyce is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Joyce will use the loan to buy more stock of fresh fruits and green vegetables. 

She will educate her children with the anticipated profit from the business. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into a charcoal selling business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fresh fruits and green vegetables.

loans.name: 8 De Febrero Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “8 DE FEBRERO”  iniciará el ciclo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ricarda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de chompa, venta de frutas, tejido de mantas, taller de cerrajería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ricarda es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa.  En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de chompas que trabaja hace años atrás, iniciando el mismo por una habilidad que tenía y la mejoró con la finalidad de abrir su propio taller.
 	
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las vendedoras por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio.
texts.en:
The “8 DE FEBRERO” communal bank will enter its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana Regional Hub. It is made up of seven members and is led by a director's board where Ricarda is the President. The businesses which the members of the communal bank run are varied, among which: knitting of sweaters, sale of fruit, knitting of blankets, and an ironworks shop.

The loan which they will obtain will benefit small micro entrepreneurs where Ricarda is a member. She mentions that she has been part of Pro Mujer for one year, having entered at the invitation of an institution promoter who came to visit her at her home. Ricarda currently has a business knitting sweaters which she has been working in for many years. She set it up thanks to the skills she had, and improved it with the aim of establishing her own workshop.

The loan which she will now obtain is to increase capital (to buy wool) which Ricarda will procure from wholesalers; she will then sell the manufactured goods in her sales area. This manner of working enables her to generate resources to support her family as far as possible, as she lives in a common law marriage and has two children.

When asked what it is she likes about Pro Mujer, Ricarda answers that she likes the consultancy aspect.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Ruby Adrian

texts.es: Ruby 26 años de edad, de oficio comerciante, padre de un hijo de dos años de edad. Inicio a los 18 años comprando y vendiendo granos básicos. Después decidió vender ropa, zapatos, y mercadería de uso doméstico, pues le generaba más ganancias. El distribuye sus productos en fábricas, empresas, casa a casa. También realiza trabajos de construcción. Su meta es poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, además de establecer su negocio en un lugar fijo. El solicito el crédito para comprar zapatos, ropas, platos, cubiertos, artículos de uso domésticos. Ya que necesita mercadería para vender en la época navideña que está cerca y necesita conseguir ingresos para ir creciendo poco a poco.
texts.en:
Ruby is 26 years old and a craft retailer, He is the father of a 2-year-old son.  He started buying and selling basic grains 18 years ago. He then decided to sell clothes, shoes, and household goods, as it generated more revenue. He distributes his products in factories and businesses, door to door. 

He also performs construction work.  His goal is to provide a better quality of life for his family, as well as establishing his business in a permanent place. The requested loan is to buy shoes, clothes, dishes, cutlery, and household goods.  He needs the merchandise to sell at Christmas time, which is coming soon, and he needs to get revenue for gradual growth.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothes, dishes, cutlery, and household goods.

loans.name: Lais Tamara

texts.es:
Lais, es una joven  de 22 años, madre, tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad, trabaja como comerciante, vende mercadería en general como ropa, zapatos, cosméticos y gaseosas. Su primer negocio fue la venta de frutas, después agrego la venta de snacks, con las ganancias comenzó a comprar mercadería en general y a vender de manera ambulante, vende sus productos en fábricas, oficinas, a clientes que viven en las afueras de la ciudad de Estelí. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pantalones, zapatos, calcetines, ropa para niños. Necesita tener inventario para vender durante la época de diciembre y sobre todo aprovechar a comprar antes que incrementen los precios. Uno de sus propósitos en lograr establecer una mini tienda y seguir trabajando para el bienestar de su hijo.
texts.en:
Lais is is a young woman, twenty-two years old, and the mother of a one-year-old child. She works as a merchant selling general merchandise such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and soft drinks. Her first business was selling fruit, later she added snacks, and with the earnings she started to buy general merchandise and and to sell by peddling. She sells her products in factories and offices, and to customers who live in the outskirts of the city of Esteli.

She is asking for a loan to buy pants, shoes, socks, and children's clothing. She needs to have inventory to sell during the season around December, and above all she needs to make the most of it by making a purchase before prices go up. One of her intentions is to establish a mini store and continue working for the wellbeing of her child.

loans.use: to buy pants, shoes, socks, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 31 years old and married with one child.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Margie is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Margie has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from basket weaving.  She is working tirelessly toward her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a basket weaving business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her weaving business.  Rebecca has been in this business for 28 years. Rebecca earns more income from pig fattening.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her weaving business.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara de cincuenta y uno años de edad vive junto a sus hijos; ella se dedica a la venta de tamales tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en la cocina y en las ventas por lo que siempre obtiene muy buenas ganancias de su producción, comercia en diferentes alrededores de la zona donde vive y es muy conocida, se ha hecho mucha clientela que la prefiere porque todo lo que comercia de es primera calidad, a precios accesible y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden del cliente; Sara es una mujer enérgica, dedicada a su labor y muy luchadora se esfuerza día a día para alcanzar el éxito que tanto desea, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para aumentar la producción, quiere invertir pero para ello necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar hojas de huerta, maíz, pollo, verduras etc. Sara tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sara, age 51, lives together with her children. She makes tamales and has been at the business for many years, gaining a lot of experience in the kitchen and in sales, which is why she always makes a really good profit from her work. She vends in various towns in the area where she lives and is very well known. She has gained many customers who prefer her because all of her tamales are top quality, sold at reasonable prices and with unparalleled service, always attending to the needs of her customers.  

Sara is an energetic woman, dedicated to her work and a real fighter in her daily effort to achieve the success she strives for so much. In recent weeks, demand has gone up and she wants to take advantage by increasing her production. She wants to invest, but in order to do that she needs more capital. That's why she's requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral [Kiva field partner] that will allow her to buy plantain leaves, corn, chicken, vegetables, etc. Sara has a good payment history and an impeccable sense of ethics, which assure that she will be able to pay back the debt on time. She is hopeful that the loan will provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy plantain leaves, corn, chicken, vegetables, etc for making tamales.

loans.name: Bebelonie

texts.en:
Bebelonie is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 27000 through NWTF to buy materials for her abaca weaving business.

NWTF is displaying Bebelonie's previous business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Berta

texts.es:
Berta, 60 años de edad, madre soltera, tiene 6 hijos, de oficio comerciante, es dueña de una pulpería, habita en la ciudad de Estelí. Su negocio de pulpería lo empezó hace 10 años pero por un tiempo lo cerró debido a que enfermo. Pero  hace dos años que la abrió de nuevo y le ha ido muy bien pues la mayoría de sus clientes antiguos volvieron a su pulpería. Ella está solicitando financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, aceite, jabón, detergentes, cloro, papel higiénico, enlatados, avenas, dulces, pan , huevo. 
Además para hacer más productiva su venta ella elabora nacatamales y tortillas. Pues su aspiración es lograr tener surtido su negocio y mejorar los ingresos para componer su casa.
texts.en:
Berta is 60 years old and is a single mother with 6 children.  She makes a living as a shopkeeper, and owns a small grocery store.  She lives in the city of Estelí.  Berta started her grocery store 10 years ago but had to close it for a while due to an illness.  However, she reopened her store two years ago and things have gone well, since most have her old customers have returned.  Berta is asking for a loan to purchase staple grains, oil, soap, detergent, bleach, toilet paper, canned goods, oats, sweets, bread, and eggs.

Berta will also use the loan to make her business more profitable by making and selling nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales) and tortillas.

Berta hopes to restock her business and improve her earnings so she can repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase staple grains, oil, soap, detergent, bleach, toilet paper, canned goods, oats, sweets, bread, and eggs.

loans.name: Cumbe  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cumbe esta formado por 7 socias quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, esta parroquia se encuentra rodeada de vegetación y de paisajes  sin igual, su centro parroquial es una mezcla de casas modernas y antiguas que conservan sus techos de teja. Su gente es de un corazón cálido, amable, gentil que su mayor orgullo es mantener la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, trabajan en la agricultura, cría de animales, comercio y algunos trabajan a diario en la ciudad y otros han migrado en busca de mejores oportunidades. Las socias son mujeres luchadoras que trabajan a diario en busca de un mejor futuro para sus familias.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Julia, tiene 21 años de edad, es casada y ha concebido un hijo de un año y seis meses de edad, está muy contenta porque se encuentra de 8 meses de embarazo y no ha tenido complicaciones. Su esposo labora como albañil en la ciudad de Cuenca, no tiene casa propia pero vive en una casa de herederos que fue de propiedad de su abuelita.

Ella por su estado actual se dedica a trabajar en los quehaceres de su hogar ya que su hijo también se encuentra muy pequeño, pero para ayudar en la economía de su hogar se dedica a la crianza de animales como cuyes y pollos a los que los vende en su comunidad, trabaja también en la agricultura pero sus cosechas son solo para el consumo de su hogar.
 
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes, pollos y alimento para animales.
 
Su sueño es culminar sus estudios Universitarios en la carrera de Contabilidad.
texts.en:
The communal bank, "Cumbe," is made up of seven members who live in the outskirts of the Cumbe parrish in Cuenca.  This parrish is surrounded by vegetation and unequaled landscapes.  The center of the area is a mix of modern and old houses with tile roofs.  Its people are warmhearted, friendly, and gentle.  Its biggest pride is keeping the culture and traditions of its people.  They work in agriculture, raising animals, and business. Some work daily in the city, and others have migrated in search of better opportunities.  The members of the communal bank are hard-working women who work daily in search of a better future for their families.

One of the members of the group is señora Julia, who is 21 and married.  She has one son who is one and a half years old.  She is very happy because she is eight months pregnant and hasn't had any complications.  Her husband works as a building worker in the city of Cuenca.  She doesn't have her own home but lives in a house that belonged to her grandmother.

Because of her current state, she works doing chores around the house since her son is very young.  To help with their home's finances, she raises animals like guinea pigs and chickens that she sells in the community.  She also works in agriculture, but her harvests are only for their family to consume.

She will use this new loan to buy guinea pigs, chickens, and animal feed.  Her dream is to finish her university studies in accounting.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens, and animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fencing and corrugated metal sheets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a responsible mother who has aimed to become successful in the future. She is 54 years old and has five grown children. Together with her husband, they have aimed to uplift their status of living to give their children a better life. 

She engages herself in hog-raising business to generate additional income. She wants  to acquire more piglets to raise, but she doesn't have enough capital. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise. 

She believes that this loan will enable her to improve business.  She is hoping that someday, she will make it more viable and a profitable source of their income.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
El Señor Wilfredo, tiene 25 años de edad y vive en unión libre con su esposa en una aldea rural del municipio de Arizona, Departamento de Atlántida.
Su actividad económica es la agricultura, dedicado específicamente a la producción de maíz, y a la cría y engorde de cerdos.
Él inicio sus labores en la agricultura desde muy joven, trabajando como jornalero. Hace 5 años que se dedica a la producción y venta de maíz y carne de cerdo.
Para la siembra del maíz, Wilfredo utiliza un terreno alquilado, actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 21,000 Lempiras, los cuales piensa invertir en la compra de insumos (fertilizante y herbicidas). El considera que dándole buen manejo y asistencia al cultivo, obtendrá una buena cosecha que le permitirá obtener mayores ganancias.
Se siente motivado a seguir con su negocio, él planea en el futuro utilizar sus ganancias para  adquirir una parcela de tierra y tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Sr. Wilfredo is 25 years old and lives with his common-law wife in a rural neighborhood in the town of Arizona in the Department of Atlántida. He is a farmer who specifically grows corn. Wilfredo also raises pigs for fattening.

He started working in agriculture at a very young age as a farm laborer. For the past five years, he has been producing and selling corn as well as pork. In order to plant corn, Wilfredo utilizes a rented plot of land. He is currently requesting a loan in the amount of 21,000 HNL. Wilfredo plans to invest in the purchase of supplies (fertilizer and herbicides). By managing his crops well and giving them attention, he hopes to obtain a good harvest and generate more income.

Wilfredo is motivated to continue with his business. In the future, he plans to utilize his profits by acquiring a parcel of land and a house of his own.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia invirtió su crédito en la reparación de muebles para su sala de belleza y se siente muy contenta, pues poco a poco está creando un ambiente confortable para sus clientes. En la actualidad, está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará una vitrina lateral para organizar los productos de belleza y en el arreglo de las paredes del local,  pues así dará una buena presentación a este y un ambiente agradable para si mismo y para quienes la visitan y acceden a sus servicios. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Gracias por los beneficios que nos dan los créditos que ustedes nos brindan, ellos son de  mucha ayuda para sacar adelante nuestros negocios”.
texts.en: Sonia invested her loan in the repair of furniture for her beauty salon, and she feels very happy as little by little she is creating a comfortable atmosphere for her customers. She is currently applying for a new Kiva loan with which she will buy a side display case to organize beauty products and she will repair the walls of the premises as this will give the business a good appearance and a pleasant ambiance for herself and for those who come to visit her and use her services. Her message to the Kiva loan lenders is the following: “Thank you for the benefits of the loans that you are giving us, they are truly of great help in getting our businesses ahead.”

loans.use: to buy a side display case to organize beauty products and repair the walls of the premises,

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es: Edilberto compró insumos como café azucar, leche, galletas, pan y mantequilla para aumentar su venta de refrigerios en la calle. Así mismo compró mercancia que su esposa vendió, quedando los dos muy satisfechos. En la actualidad está aplicando aun nuevo credikiva, con el que comprará mercancia variada para responder a la temporada de amor y amistad,  como accesorios femeninos, prendas de fantasia cosméticos etc. Así mismo invertirá en la compra de dos termos de café mas, ampliando así,  sus posibilidades en la oferta de sus productos. Su mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva es el siguiente: " Estoy agradecido ya que los prestamos nos han servido para ampliar el negocio y generar mas ingresos para la familia y espero continuen apoyandonos.
texts.en:
Edilberto purchased supplies like coffee, sugar, milk, cookies, bread, and butter to boost his sale of snacks on the street. He also bought merchandise that his wife sold, leaving the two very satisfied. Right now Edilberto is applying for a new Kiva loan to buy various merchandise to meet the demands of the month of love and friendship [the month of September in Colombia, celebrated instead of Valentine's Day in February], such as women's accessories, costume jewellery, cosmetics, etc. He will also invest in the purchase of two new coffee urns in order to increase the possibility of offering his products.

His message to Kiva lenders is this: "I'm grateful because these loans have allowed me to grow my business and generate more income for my family, and I hope you will continue to support us."

loans.use: to buy women's accessories, costume jewellery, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a 23 year old business man.  He is married to Stella, a mixed crop farmer. They are blessed with one child. He has been selling compact disks for the past two years, earning the monthly income of KES 5,000. which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  Dominic will use the loan to buy more disks for sale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to open a bigger shop and to venture into the shoe selling business.

loans.use: to buy more compact disks.

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en:
Abdu, forty, lives in a house he owns with his common-law wife and their three children. Abdu owns a timber store and sells high quality timber. He has been doing this for five years and has been able to stay in business thanks to God and his determination. Many people go to him, because he offers quality and good prices. Abdu sells his timber mostly to carpenters. 

As of lately, Abdu's client numbers have increased, and demand is higher every day. Abdu's dream is to be able to see his business flourish. Therefore, he has decided to request this loan in order to purchase more timber to sell. Also, he wants to buy trees to cut into timber, since he has a saw mill.

loans.use: to purchase more timber to sell and trees to produce more timber.

loans.name: Mery Ann

texts.en: Mery Ann is a hard working mother who's aim is to become successful in the future.  She is 39 years old, married, and has four school-age children.  She is engaged in the vegetable vending business to supplement her husband's income.  She sells her products within their village through house to house delivery.  She aims to acquire more fruits and vegetables to sell, but she has insufficient capital.  Therefore, she is asking for a loan of P5,000.00 to buy bananas, pechay, tomatoes, eggplants, cabbages, beans, and squash to sell.  She believes that through her patience and hard work, she will improve the business and make it a viable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy bananas, pechay, tomatoes, eggplants, cabbages, beans and squash to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables and spices to resell.

loans.name: Los Andenes Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS ANDENES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Roxana ella es soltera y tiene 31 años; La socia trabaja en una empresa publica de la ciudad de Cusco,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia también acaba de abrir su restaurant,ella contrata un acocinera y un mozo para que en su restaurant atiendan porque ella no tiene tiempo porque trabaja casi todo el dia,la socia ya tiene en su trbajo 5 años y por medio de este trbajo la socia quiere salir adelante,en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta preparar tortas,el sueño de la socia es temner un locla mas amplio para su restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo,carne y verduras y también para comprar ollas,platos y cucharas para el restaurant. 
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de alquiler de habitaciones, negocio de servicio de taxi y negocio de restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "Los Andenes." The bank is located in the district of Cusco, pertaining to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Roxana.  She is single and 31 years old.  She works in a public company of the city of Cusco, working from 8 am until 5 pm.  She also just opened a restaurant, hiring a cook and a waiter to run it because she doesn't have time because she works almost the entire day.  She has worked 5 years in her position, and through this work she hopes to get ahead.  In her free time she likes to cook tortas.  Her dream is to have a larger place for her restaurant.  She requests a loan to buy cooking products like chicken, meat and vegetables, and also to buy pots, plates and spoons for the restaurant.

The other members work in a grocery store, a room renting business, a taxi business and a restaurant.

She thanks those who form part of this dream through these means, and promises to complete her payments in the established time.

loans.use: to buy cooking products like chicken, meat and vegetables, and also to buy pots, plates and spoons for the restaurant.

loans.name: Virgen Natividad Umanes Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD UMANES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Martina  ella es conviviente y tiene 31 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria en las ferias y en uno de los mercados, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que más le solicitan ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de de esta forma que la socia  saca adelante  a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como arroz, aceité y menestras para su negocio.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de granos secos, agricultura, elaboración de tejidos, crianza de animales, albañil.

Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta son socios que pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión de equipo y la socia que sale en la foto con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These borrowers belong to the Virgen Natividad Umanes Communal Bank. This bank is based in the district of Chinchero, belonging to Urubamba province and Cusco department.

One member, Martina, is 31 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has three children. She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling food. She sells in an ambulatory manner at fairs and in one of the markets. She has been in this business for years and it is going well thanks to the dedication she puts into her work each day. At the same time, she raises small animals like guinea pigs and chickens. She raises these animals to later sell to customers who request them. Martina is a responsible and earnest woman who does this work in order to get her family ahead.

Martina is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for her business like rice, oil, and mixed vegetables.

The other members sell dried grains, work in agriculture, make knit goods, raise animals, or work in masonry.

The members who are in the separate photographs requested permission to arrive late to the team meeting and the woman in the main photo with her face covered does not belong to this communal bank.

Martina thanks all those who, in this manner, form part of her dream, and she promises to comply with her repayments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, oil and mixed vegetables

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой, так как ей необходимо провести мероприятие внука.     Год назад она выдала дочь замуж.  Теперь когда у дочки родился сын, Манзура должна провести мероприятие для внука и купить несколько подарков для них.  Манзура работает на станции диспетчером, но заработная плата хватает только на проживание.  Ее муж находится на заработках РТ он присылает деньги но на такие крупные расходы не хватает.   Манзура хочет купить коляску и гахвора (национальная колыбелька), для внука, так как по традиции это является обязательным подарком каждой бабушки.  Она рада что может получить поддержку со стороны Арванд и без препятствий провести своё мероприятие.  Заранее благодарит.
texts.en: Manzura turned to MDO Arvand for financial support as she needs to organize a celebration for her grandson. A year ago she gave her daughter away in marriage. Now that her daughter has given birth to a son, Manzura has to organize a celebration and buy some gifts. Manzura works as a dispatcher, but her salary is sufficient only for running expenses. Her husband  is a migrant worker [in the Russian Federation]; he send them money, but it is not enough for major purchases. Manzura would like to buy a stroller and a “gakhvora,” a traditional cradle for her grandson, since the tradition dictates that every grandmother buys such a gift for her grandchildren. She appreciates getting support from Arvand and being able to organize her event without difficulty. She thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy gifts for her grandson.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more school supplies and snacks to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Niko

texts.en: Niko was born 21 years ago in Galai Dubu village, Pulau-pulau Aru Subdistrict, in North Maluku District. His father works as a carpenter and he has two siblings. Niko is the oldest. He wants to continue his education after finishing Vocational School for Tourism, in Langgur city. He wants to continue his education at the Maritime Academy but his parents can’t give him money for his education because his parents have to be thinking of his two brothers who need to continue their school through Senior High School. His friends told him that in Cilacap-Central in Java, there is a Maritime Academy that can help him pay for his education through the Student Loans Program. Niko asked for this loan to pay for his education fees at the Maritime Academy Nusantara in Cilacap. His dream, when he finishes his education from Maritime Academy, is to have an opportunity to work in The Government Marine Transportation Services in North Maluku.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a 22-year-old who considers himself to be a responsible, calm and very hard-working person. Mohamed lives with his parents in Msambweni. He works selling goats and cows at the market and to the slaughterhouses. This business helps meet his family's household expenses. 

At the moment, Mohamed needs to expand the business by buying more livestock to sell, and this is why he is taking out a loan through Yehu. The loan will be invested in the purchase of goats to sell. Mohamed dreams of having a bigger herd of livestock to earn more profit.

loans.use: to purchase goats to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca, age 54, runs a sari-sari (general store) business. She has run this business for 12 years and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care items, home use products, and beverages. She and her husband have three children.

Rebecca joined HSPFI this year and has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale.

In the future, Rebecca hopes to improve her business for the sake of ensuring the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Reno

texts.en: Reno comes from Alor. Alor is a small district with lower economic income levels. There are a lot of small ports but there is only one big shipping office, named Pelindo.  Reno is 18 years old and the youngest child in his family. Reno’s parents are farmers with four children, so their income is not enough to pay the education fees for their children's higher education, including Reno. Reno has a big spirit and wants to continue his education on a higher level, even though he realizes his parents don't have enough money. Reno wants to continue his education at the Maritime Academy. He hopes when he finishes his education, he can work for Pelindo shipping company in his hometown and with a better income, he can help his parents to have a better life when they are older. Reno asks your help to pay for his education fees at the Maritime Academy in Cilacap, so his dream to make his parents happy will come true.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruits to resell.

loans.name: Roubi

texts.en:
Roubi is 44 years old and married. She is a contented client of Kashf foundation who helps her husband in the business of shoemaking.  Her husband has been attached to the business for about 15 years. He worked really hard in making shoes by hand. 

Years later, Roubi got knowledge about the cost-effective financial services of Kashf foundation.  She applied for a loan to expand their business and purchase the raw materials, such as soles and plastic leather in the amalgamation of shoes to gain the maximum. 

But to prepare the maximum number of shoes manually was hard and took time. After the acquisition of next loan, they purchased a shoe-stitching machine. Moreover, their sons assisted in the same business, to make the work easy and maximize the production.  Their sale increased up to double, and profit got healthier consequently. 

Now one of her son deals in sales and marketing in the local market, and they are reaping the reasonable benefit from their well established business. Their joint efforts enable them to cover the expenditures of all the basic amenities of life, like utilities, electrical home appliances, personal conveyance (motorbike), health facilities,etc.

At present Roubi has requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to buy more raw materials, such as leather, plastic leather, soles, and reels of threads. In this way, she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. 

As a future plan, they are eager to expand their business by manufacturing different types of shoes, such as school shoes, kids shoes, etc., to cater to many customers. 

Roubi openly acknowledge the services provided to all clients by Kashf Foundation at their doorstep, such as education and training in financial activities like budgeting, savings, information about various facilities of depositing their monthly installment at the nearest UBL Omni outlet, due awareness, and training about their respective business's growth.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials, such as leather, plastic leather, soles and reels of threads.

loans.name: Nkeiyoni

texts.en:
Nkeiyoni is 56 years old and married, and she supports a family of eight people. She is a wheat farmer for the last eight years, earning a monthly income of KES 50,000. 

She is servicing her fourth loan of KES.40,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to purchase farm inputs. The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep keeping. 

Her future dream is to improve her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for her wheat farm.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Puyo, es el cantón capital de la Provincia de Pastaza, una provincia que forma parte importante de la Región Amazónica del Ecuador, siendo el centro de la selva amazónica. En su capital Puyo se puede gozar de un agradable clima y un paisaje esplendoroso con ríos, cascadas diversidad de fauna y flora por lo que turistas nacionales y extranjeros llegan a deleitarse de estos cálidos atractivos. Por ser el turismo una de las actividades económicas más importantes, en el centro de la ciudad se encuentra fácilmente todos los servicios para acoger al turista como son hoteles, hosterías, restaurantes, instituciones financieras, etc. También los habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería que son favorecidas con la tierra fértil que posee este lugar. Sin duda El Puyo es una ciudad que vale la pena visitar ya que ha crecido mucho en los últimos años por el espíritu emprendedor y trabajador de su gente. En medio de esta ciudad vive Magdalena una mujer de 56 años, soltera y con estudios primarios aprobados. Tiene 4 hijos que ya son adultos y por lo tanto independientes a quienes ha sacado adelante sola gracias a su trabajo.
Magdalena emprendió hace 7 años con el establecimiento de venta de productos de primera necesidad, negocio que fue enseñado por su nuera que tenía experiencia por su familia de comerciantes. Magdalena invierte desde 12 hasta 15 horas diarias ininterrumpidamente. Ella estima que la temporada en donde los estudiantes de escuelas y colegios inician su período normal de clases existe una mayor demanda por lo cual ella se acercó a Fundación Alternativa a solicitar un préstamo para comprar productos que le permiten ofrecer variedad a sus clientes, préstamo por el cual está muy agradecida ya que con la asesoría y capacitación recibida allí podrá dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y de esta forma posicionarse en el sector y así incrementar sus ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida ahora y para el futuro.
texts.en:
Puyo is the capital of the province Pastaza, a province that forms an important part of the Amazon region of Ecuador because it is at the center of the Amazon jungle. In Puyo you can enjoy a pleasant climate and a magnificent landscape with rivers, waterfalls, and a diversity of flora and fauna. Ecuadorians and foreigners alike come to delight in these attractions. Tourism is one of the most important economic activities in Puyo and in the city center you can easily find all of the services needed to accommodate tourists such as hotels, hostels, restaurants, banks, etc. People in this area also make a living in agriculture and livestock which are favoured because of the region's fertile land. Without a doubt, Puyo is a city worth visiting; it has grown a lot in recent years due to the entrepreneurial spirit and hard work of its people.

In the midst of this city lives Magdalena, a woman who is 56 years old, single, and has completed her primary school education. She has four children who are now adults and therefore independent; but it is only thanks to her work have they have been able to get ahead.

Seven years ago, Magdalena launched a business selling staple goods, a trade she learned from her daughter-in-law who had experience because she came from a family of merchants. Magdalena invests between 12 and 15 uninterrupted hours every day to her work. She estimates that in the time when students from primary and secondary school start their normal period of classes, there will be an increased demand for the products she sells. For that reason, she approached the Fundación Alternativa to ask for a loan in order to buy products that will allow her to offer a greater variety to her customers. She is grateful for this loan and for the assistance and training she received at the foundation, so that she may provide better service to her customers and in this way position herself in the industry, increase her income, and improve her quality of life both now and in the future.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products for her business

loans.name: Irma Yolanda

texts.es: Irma Yolanda vive junto a su madre, su hermana y su hijo Carlos, ella se dedica a la venta de comida rápida tortas, hamburguesas, hot dog entre otros, tiene varios años con el pequeño negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia valiosa que le permite elaborar la mejor comida, se encuentra ubicado a las afueras de una escuela, todo el lugar es muy concurrido y los estudiantes son sus mejores clientes, cada día se hace de mas clientela las personas lo prefieren porque todo es elaborado con material de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes; Irma es una mujer dedicada a su labor, enérgica y muy luchadora siempre esta a la expectativa de opciones que le abran camino a un futuro mas prospero y sabe que solo con constancia y esfuerzo lograra el éxito que desea; ahora que aumento la demanda quiere aprovechar para aumentar la inversión pero necesita de capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar un carretón para la venta e insumos pan, carnes, aderezos, etc. Irma Yolanda tiene buenas referencias de pago es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Irma Yolanda lives together with her mother, brother, and her son Carlos. She makes a living selling fast food such as cakes, hamburgers, hot dogs, and more. She has spent several years in this small business, and this has given her valuable experience which allows her to prepare the best food for fer customers. She is located just outside of a school; the whole place is very busy and students are her best customers. Every day she has more customers that prefer her food because everything is made with the best quality ingredients, sold at reasonable prices and with unparalleled customer service. 

Irma is a woman dedicated to her work; she is energetic, and a fighter who is always looking out for options that will open a path to a more prosperous future. She knows that only through perseverance and effort can she achieve the success she desires. She wishes to take advantage of increasing demand and grow through an investment, but she needs the capital to back it. For that reason she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy a vendors' cart and supplies like bread, meat, dressings, etc. Irma Yolanda has good payment references and is very responsible. She is sure that she will be able to repay the debt and at the same time has faith that this will give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy a venders' cart, bread, meat, and dressings

loans.name: Cooperativa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “COOPERATIVA”  iniciará el ciclo sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Jacinta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio de frutas, venta de cordones y pitas, venta de deportivos, trenzado de mantas, venta de sogas, artesanía en mantas, tienda de internet.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Jacinta es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa.  En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de sombreros; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió hace años aprendiendo este oficio de su esposo que trabajaba en este negocios y para ampliarlo decidió participar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cuero) que adquirirá de las vendedoras por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijas.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en:
The “COOPERATIVA” communal bank will start the sixth loan cycle in Pro Mujer, as the Panamericana Regional Hub. It is made up of eight members and is run by a governing board where Jacinta is the President. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied, among which: sale of fruits, sale of cords and twines, sale of sportswear, plaiting of blankets, sale of rope, blanket handicrafts and an Internet store. 

The loan will serve to benefit the micro entrepreneurs where Jacinta is a member. Jacinta says that she entered Pro Mujer two years ago at the invitation of an institute promoter who visited her at her home. She currently has a business sewing hats, and she recounts how she started it many years ago, learning the trade from her husband who worked in this business, and to expand it, she decided to participate too. 

The loan which she will now obtain is to increase capital (to buy leather) which she will procure from wholesalers and subsequently sell the manufactured goods in her sales space. This manner of working enables her to generate resources to support her family as far as possible as she is married and has two girls.

When asked what it is she likes about Pro Mujer, Jacinta answers that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy leather.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corn at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Sakibe

texts.en:
Sakibe, age 36, is employed as a cleaner. She comes from a vulnerable ethnic minority community in Kosovo. She is married and has three children between the ages of 11 and 16 years old. One of them is going to school. Sakibe's husband is employed as a driver. 

Many people from these minority communities in Kosovo, including Sakibe’s family, live in poor conditions. This family lives in an old, small house with only two rooms, one of which is in critical need of repair. The money that Sakibe and her husband generate is not enough to cover all of the family's daily living expenses. Raising children and keeping food on the table is difficult for them. Adding the cost of repairs to a room in the house is nearly impossible. 
 
Sakibe recently decided to request this loan in order to fix the room in need of repair. Her goal is to improve her family’s living conditions. She promises to repay the loan on time. 

Sakibe is very grateful to her Kiva lenders for improving her family’s standard of living and contributing to her children’s overall health.

loans.use: to make essential repairs to one of the two rooms of the family house

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en: Rose Marie is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Rose Marie has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for nine years. She requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Rose Marie has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Rose Marie hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods,snacks and beverages

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Farzana, age 22, is a vigorous unmarried lady. She did not get married due to lacking the money for a wedding. Four years ago, she started a parlor in a small corner of her two-room house. Along with her younger sister Sameen, she works hard day and night to give the parlor a strong local reputation so that they may be able to provide for the family. 

Farzana and Sameen labor tirelessly to keep the business running because they are the breadwinners of the house. There are seven dependents on these two women since none of their siblings are old enough to earn themselves. Two of their sisters are enrolled in school. 

The sisters have reported to Kashf that it has been getting extremely difficult to manage the family, as the parlor is running on minimal necessities, causing clients to be hesitant to avail themselves of the parlor's services. This is why Farzana has requested a loan worth RS 25,000 from Kashf. She tells us that she will be using the loan to invest in utensils, cosmetics, and some furniture items for the parlor.

loans.use: to invest in utensils, cosmetics, and some furniture items for her beauty parlor

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 34-year-old man married with three children and one wife. He is a very hardworking man and his major source of income is the cattle trade. He buys the cows when they are still young and fattens them for a period of three months and then sells them at a profit. Robert started this business because he realized he was mature enough and had a family to take care of; it was time for him to lead an independent life.

Robert's major challenge is limited space for grazing, but he hopes to buy more land as he makes more profit from the business. He also intends to construct a permanent house for his family and send his children to good schools.

loans.use: to purchase bulls to sell.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is from a small village in the Tsalka district. She is 25 years old and lives with her husband Leri. The family is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, they run a small dairy farm of three calves and three milk cows, whose milk is used for dairy production. Maia produces dairy products and sells them in her village and in the nearby villages. She is a very hard-working young woman with a great desire to get ahead. 

She requested a loan to purchase food for her cattle. With this loan, she will purchase hay, which will be used for feeding the cattle during the fall and winter seasons. Since the calves will be fed properly in winter, Maia will be able to receive a planned amount of milk and produce dairy products. This will increase the income of the family. With the increased income, Maia will improve the living conditions of the family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase hay for cattle feed

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene de   38 anos de edad, madre soltera con dos hijos de 18,9 anos estudiantes. Marlene es del municipio de Malpaisillo del departamento  de león el cual esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Ella tiene por actividad económica la venta de  artesanía y cerámica desde hace 14 anos. El negocio consiste en salir a vender dos veces al mes al país de vecino de Costa Rica donde ya tiene encargos de clientes fijos y eventuales. Sus productos son venta adornos de barro muñecas, ángeles, floreros, jarrones, adornos de cocina, barriles, molinillos. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y de dicha forma aumentar sus ganancias, ofreciendo mejor y mayor calidad en su servicio. Marlene ya ha trabajado con fundación con otros créditos  y ha demostrado ser excelente paga en tiempo y forma. La Sra. agradece la ayuda que brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
Marlene, 38, is a single mother of 2.  Her children, aged 18 and 9, attend school.  Marlene is from the municipality of Malpaisillo, in the department of Leon, which is located in the western part of the country.  

Marlene has had a business selling handicrafts and ceramics for 14 years.  She goes to sell twice a month to neighboring Costa Rica, because she has advance orders from regular and casual customers.
