She sells decorated products made of clay, including dolls, angels, vases, jars, kitchen decorations, barrels, and chocolate stirrers.  

Marlene needs a loan to use as working capital so that she can increase her earnings by offering more products and providing better quality service.  Marlene has already worked with the FUNDACION and other Kiva loans, and has demonstrated an excellent history of making her payments on time and in full.  Marlene is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders are providing to people with few economic resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent life.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts and ceramics to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, age 38, is a welder. He has been engaged in his welding business for the past six years with a monthly income of KES 10,500, which he uses to support his family. His wife Susan is a farmer. They have two children. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. James will use the loan to buy metal scrap.

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will ensure the education of his children. His hopes and dreams are to venture into a hotel business and to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy metal scrap

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a dedicated woman who always finds opportunities on how she will prosper. She sells mattresses and pillows in a shop, a business she has done for some time.  She also sells spare parts in her shop. She says that it is profitable, and she is sure she will achieve her goals. 

Fatuma has realised that demand has increased over the past few weeks, and she wants to take this advantage. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to stock up more mattresses and pillows for sale.  This way, she will be able to provide better living standards for her family.

loans.use: to stock up more mattresses and pillows for sale.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu, who is 28 years old, is a married mother of two children.  She lives in Msambweni. 

Mwanatumu has been working since last year. She’s always had her own source of income. She sells clothes from place to place and also on order. 

She will use the loan she’s requesting to buy two large bundles of mixed clothes to increase her inventory and fill customer orders.  Her reason for investing in the business is to generate more income for her family’s well-being. 

Mwanatumu dreams of opening a boutique in future.

loans.use: to buy two large bundles of mixed clothes.

loans.name: Roshan

texts.en:
Ms. Roshan, age 49, runs a hand embroidery business from her home, a venture she has been running for two years. Her design work is very well-known in her town. She and her husband have six children. Ms. Roshan makes a reasonable income; however, her husband’s income is very unpredictable and is not enough to cover the family's everyday expenditures. 

Ms. Roshan is in charge of providing her family with good food, health, and education. She has slowly but surely improved her business by taking out loans from the Kashf Foundation and investing the funds into her business. 

She has requested a loan in the amount of Rs 20,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors, which will allow her to meet the increasing demand for her embroidery designs. She is confident that her profits will increase and thus allow her to better support her family. She will also spend a portion of her increased earnings to ensure the education of her two daughters.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors, which will allow her to meet the increasing demand for her embroidery designs

loans.name: Rahsana

texts.en:
Rahsana is an energetic woman who has been in the business of making jewelry for about 20 years. 

She works hard every day so she may earn a living for her family. She is a mother of six children, and her husband works as a laborer on daily wages in a factory. She is contributing a lot to the family income. Her husband feels proud of his wife's performance.

She has improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation gradually. She is in her fifth loan cycle, and she has requested a loan of Rs 30,000.  She will use it to purchase different kinds of metal, steel, and pearls from the market at lower rates for embellishment in her jewelry. 

She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of metal, steel, and pearls to make her jewelry.

loans.name: Leyda De Jesus

texts.es: Leyda de Jesús  de  39 anos de edad casada con  2 hijos menores de edad de 11, 9 anos. Del departamento de León. Leyda es una mujer que ha luchado duro para desde muy joven para salir adelante con sus hijos. Ella tiene por actividad económica la elaboración y venta de tortillas, actividad que la  desempeña desde hace 9 anos. La cual inicio por la necesidad de aportar con los gastos del hogar ya que tenían un hijo más y para el esposo la carga era muy pesada. Su rutina de trabajo es de levantarse todos los días a preparar el maíz a la 4: am para tener que salir a vender las tortillas una vez terminado con la elaboración de la misma regresando a su casa como a las  5 PM. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo como la compra de: maíz, Lena, comal, cal, gas, fosforo. Bolsas plásticas.   Leyda de Jesús agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva les brindan a las personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Leyda de Jesús, 39, is married with 2 young children aged 9 and 11. Coming from the department of León, Leyda is a woman who has fought hard early on in life to get ahead with her children. 

Her economic activity is making and selling tortillas, an activity which she has been performing for 9 years. She started it through the need to contribute to the household expenditure as they had one more child and the load was too great for her husband. Her work routine is to wake up every day to prepare the corn at 4:00 am in order to go out to sell the tortillas once she has finished making them, returning home around 5:00 pm. 

She needs the finance to invest in working capital to buy corn, firewood, hot plates to make the tortillas, lime, gas, matches and plastic bags. Leyda de Jesús is thankful for the help which the Kiva investors give people with scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a dignified manner of working.

loans.use: to invest in working capital for the purchase of: corn, firewood, hot plates to make tortillas, lime, gas, matches and plastic bags,

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, a 35-year-old widowed mother of four, has been a mixed crop farmer for the past 10 years. She earns a monthly income of KES.20,000 which she uses to support her family.

Having repaid her previous loan, Lucy is requesting her second one with KADET LTD to buy seedlings and fertilizer. With the anticipated profits from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to export her farm produce.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Justian Yuliana

texts.es:
Justian es una mujer de 24 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su pequeño hijo de 3 años, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Gracias al apoyo de su madre, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Justian tiene una pequeña anticuchería, donde vende anticuchos en cañitas, bofe, hígado, rachi, entre otros deliciosos platos; ella trabaja todos los días y puede dedicar un aproximado de 12 horas a su negocio, Justian se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes. 
Justian se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de sillas y mesas para su negocio; de esta manera Justian tendrá su negocio mejor acondicionado, brindando mayor comodidad para sus clientes, así ella espera aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda ampliar su negocio y tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
Justian is a 24 year-old woman who lives in the city of Chincha with her little 3 year-old son.  She loves her son; he is her main reason for living.  She is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who has a strong desire to get ahead.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work, she was not able to study for the professional degree in education that she wanted.  But she very much would have liked to have done so.  In her free time, she enjoys listening to music, and at times she enjoys cooking the delicious "Arroz con Pollo" (chicken and rice) dish to share with her family.

Thanks to the support of her mother, and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Justian has a small food stand where she sells grilled beef hearts on skewers, lungs, livers, tripe, and other delicious dishes. She works every day and dedicates approximately 12 hours to her business. Justian feels content with her work and believes she is doing well because of the delicious flavor of her dishes and the friendly service she provides to her customers. 

Justian is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the assistance they have provided, she will be able to purchase tables and chairs for her business. As a result, her business will be better equipped, and she will be able to provide more comfort to her customers.  This way, Justian hopes to increase her sales and her earnings, which will help her greatly, because in the near future she hopes to expand her business and have her own restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her business

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es: Pedro Antonio de  37 anos de edad, casado con dos hijos de 14,8 anos. Del municipio de Sauce.  EL Sauce e un lugar ubicado en la parte norte del pais , el cual se caracteriz por una zona productora de leche.Tiene por actividad económica  una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Negocio que surgió  como una necesidad  obtener mas ingresos para mantener a su familia, porque el salario que el devenga como maestro de su localidad  es muy bajo y no le permitía brindarle a sus hijos seguridad y estabilidad económica. Una pulpería es una  tienda donde vende productos de consumo diario y en cantidades pequeña  como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceité, bolsitas de café, bolsitas de salsa de tomate, caja de fósforos. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pequeña pulpería y brindarle mejor atención a su cliente. Pedro Antonio agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua facilitándole un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Pedro Antonio, 37, is married and has two children, ages 14 and 8.  He is from the town of Sauce. Sauce is a place located in the northern part of the country, which is characterized as a milk-producing zone. 

To support him economically, he has a small grocery store located in his home. This business arose as a necessity to obtain more income to support his family, because the salary that he accrues as head of the household is very low, and it was not allowing him to offer his children security and economic stability.

A small grocery store is a store where products for daily consumption are sold in small quantities, such as: rice, beans, sugar, oil, bags of coffee, packages of tomato sauce, and boxes of matches.

He needs financing to be able to invest in working capital, stock his small grocery store, and offer better attention to his clients. Pedro Antonio appreciates the help that the Kiva investors offer to people with few resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua, by providing a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock his grocery store with products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, bags of coffee, packages of tomato sauce, and  boxes of matches.

loans.name: Fabien

texts.en:
Fabien is 53 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 30 years. He will use his Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer for maize production: He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Ms Gulshan is 54 years old and has been successfully doing a business making juice for the past four years. She makes delicious orange juice at home and serves it in her community. She is very popular in her town and appreciated by her customers. She works hard to diversify her livelihood, as she understands that she should not depend solely on the income earned by her husband. Her husband is employed in a general store and earns too little income to support his family alone. 

She is a mother of six children and in charge of providing them with the basic necessities of life.  Her business has improved gradually. She needs to expand her sales, so she contacted Kashf Foundation and requested a loan of Rs 30,000/- to buy stock of sugar and packs of different flavors to increase production. She is very excited about this new loan and wants to spend a portion of the profits on her children’s education and home renovation.

loans.use: To buy sugar and packs of flavorings to increase production.

loans.name: Mwalale

texts.en:
Mwalale is 54 years old and a business lady.  She is married to Syomiti who is a business man.  They are blessed with five children.  She has been in the livestock trading business for the past seven years.  She earns KES 7,340 in monthly income, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  Mwalale will use the loan to buy more goats and sheep. 

With the anticipated profits from the business, she will educate her last born child, since the others are adults.  Her hopes and dreams are to buy a pickup for transporting livestock to the nearby markets.

loans.use: to buy more goats and sheep.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es: Por muchos años Joaquín ha tenido una relación muy estrecha con el cultivo de café fue hasta hace poco tiempo que se comenzó a dedicar a producirlo debido a un terreno que le fue heredado por su padre y su tio. Joaquín combina sus labores de cafeticultor con su trabajo en un beneficio de café y para que esto sea posible él contrata a jornaleros que se encargan de ayudarlo a realizar las labores propias del campo y de esta manera también ayuda a la economía familiar de las personas que contrata. La producción anual de Joaquín actualmente es de 2.5 toneladas pero sabe que con la extensión de terreno que cuenta es suficiente para llegar a producir hasta 8 toneladas anuales y por eso ha renovado mucha de su planta para que en un lapso de 3 años pueda alcanzar su meta. Él necesita comprar fertilizante, planta y hacer labores de limpieza y conservación de sus parcelas y para eso necesita de un crédito. Él quiere hacer que sus fincas produzcan más para que en el futuro se las pueda dejar a sus hijos para que ellos las trabajen.
texts.en:
For many years, Joaquín has had a very close relationship with coffee growing. It was not until recently that he began to devote himself to its production, due to the fact that he inherited land from his father and uncle. 

Joaquín combines his labors as a coffee farmer with his work at a coffee processing plant and in order for this to be possible he hires day-laborers that are charged with helping him perform the tasks in the field. In this manner he also helps the family finances of the people he hires. 

Joaquín's current annual production is 2.5 tons, but he knows that the land extension that he is expecting would be sufficient to allow him to produce up to 8 tons annually, therefore he has renewed many of his plants so that within 3 years he can reach his goal.

He needs to buy fertilizer, plants, and perform cleaning tasks and conservation of his plots of land, and for that he needs a loan. He wants to make his farms produce more so that in the future he can leave them to his children so that they can work on them.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, coffee plants, and to clean his grounds

loans.name: Talhat

texts.en:
Talhat is a well-known tailor in her community. She stitches clothes and bed covers for more than half of the members of the community she lives in. She started this line of work almost 16 years ago when her husband fell ill and was unable to support the family. 

Talhat has built up a successful tailoring business with two stitching machines and her daughter as her assistant. Her daughter helps her so that she is able to fulfill orders in less time. She earns enough to lead a decent and respectable life. Talhat told Kashf: “This is what I have done - nothing remarkable but I have fulfilled my responsibility towards my children who will now go to school and gain knowledge that I was never able to acquire." 

She has requested a loan in the amount of RS 25,000 in order to purchase more materials for her business, such as reels of threads, laces, and cloth of different colors in bulk. She hopes to earn more income by targeting more customers.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business, such as reels of threads, laces, and cloth of different colors in bulk

loans.name: Safdar's Group

texts.en:
Safdar is a 50-year-old hardworking and independent woman. She lives in Pakistan with her husband and two sons. Her husband is jobless. As she has sufficient skills in tailoring, she wants to generate some income by stitching clothes so that she can meet the family's needs and expenses. But to start her tailoring business, she needs a tailoring (sewing) machine. For that, Safdar, as a member of a 10-person group, has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education. With the profit, she will open her own boutique in the future. Lots of prayer for BRAC and KIVA from Safdar. 

Note: In the picture, Safdar is holding a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is 32 years old and a mixed crop farmer who is married to Tabitha, a business lady. They are blessed with two children. He has been selling spare parts as a primary business and mixed crop farming as a secondary business for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Denis will use the loan to buy more stock of spare parts. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to export his farm produce.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en:
Nazira is married and has three children.  She has always wanted to provide them with a good education.  Since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, she has decided to start a new business in animal husbandry to generate income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances.  

She works at the school as a math teacher and earns a small salary.  She studied in a course called "To Get Ahead" at a women's organization and learned enough skills about business.  She will be a very successful business woman as she is hardworking and smart.  

She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy cattle for organizing her new business.  She will make it through, using the loan, and her business will become a source of income, so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress.  She awaits your support.

loans.use: buy cattle to start a husbandry business.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Ms. Naseem is a 39-year-old woman and is a benefited client of the Kashf Foundation. She is running a business of a stitching school at home, where she provides training to students about stitching techniques. She has been attached to the respective business for almost five years. Back then she was struggling with one stitching machine to train the students. As she got the knowledge about the cost-effective financial services of Kashf Foundation, she applied for a loan to expand her business by purchasing new machinery. Now she has requested a loan of Rs 10,000 to buy furniture to accommodate more students. She desires to spend the portion of her profit on the betterment of her family and children’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy furniture to accommodate more students.

loans.name: Mwero

texts.en: Mwero is taking out a new loan so as to expand on his existing business. With the previous investment, he was able to purchase cows and goats. This enabled him to earn more profits. Mwero states that the major challenge to his business is disease outbreak and theft. With the profits, he was also able to finish constructing his house. Thankful for this business, he wants to expand it and purchase a motorcycle taxi in the future. With this loan, he wants to buy six cows and pay for their transport labor to the market.

loans.use: to buy six cows and pay for their transport labor to the market.

loans.name: Dalia Sonia

texts.es: Dalia Sonia de 49 anos de edad, madre soltera con un 1 hijo de 13 ano y estudia en la secundaria y esta  bajo su responsabilidad, Ella es originaria del municipio de  Sauce, lugar que se caracteriza por ser una zona productora de leche, cuajada, crema.  Ella tiene por actividad económica una pulpería y venta de refrescos  ubicada en su casa de habitación. Cuenta con una experiencia de 8 anos. La rutina diaria de Dalia es por la mañana presta su servicio como maestra de un colegio , del cual vio la necesidad de ofrecerle  y llevarle refresco de venta a sus alumnos hoy en día el negocio ha crecido y aumento sus productos en su pequeña tienda, y por la tarde de dedica a ver su negocio en su casa. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pequeño negocio con productos como: golosinas, churritos, gelatinas, refrescos naturales, refrescos elaborados con leche. Dalia Sonia ya  ha trabajado con fundación León  2000 y ha demostrado ser responsable con sus pagos en tiempo y forma. La Sra. Agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a las personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
Dalia Sonia is a 49-year-old single mother of one 13-year-old son, who is under her care and attends secondary school. She is a native of the city of Sauce, a place known for its production of milk, cuajada [a popular cheese curd], and cream. The business she has is a small grocery store and refreshment stand located in her house. She has eight years of experience.

Dalia's daily routine consists of working as a teacher in a school in the mornings, where she saw a need for bringing refreshments to offer for sale to her students. Today, the business has grown and she has added to the products in her little store. In the afternoons, she works minding the shop in her house. 

She needs the loan to invest in working capital to stock her little shop with products like candy, churritos [cheese-filled fried pastries], gelatins, and refreshing juice-based and milk-based drinks. Dalia Sonia has already worked with Fundación Leon 2000 and has shown herself to be responsible and punctual with her loan payments. She is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders have offered to people with limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have a decent way of life.

loans.use: to invest in working capital to stock her neighborhood market with products like candy, pastries, gelatins, and drinks.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 34-year-old married woman. She describes herself as determined and aggressive. She operates a beauty salon where she provides hair beauty services. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located within a fast growing urban area, and her primary customers are business people and residents form the community. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy beauty products to be used in her beauty salon, such as treatments, weaves, shampoos, conditioners, etc. Her business goal is to run a spa within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy land for her family. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to be used in her beauty salon

loans.name: Uzma's Group

texts.en:
Uzma is a 42-year-old woman who is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, daughter and two sons. Her husband and son are doing jobs while she has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly for the past seven years. Her clients always appreciate her work. 

Uzma, as a member of a seven-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, she will buy a variety of fabrics in different colors, as well as some tailoring materials like buttons and zippers to fill orders of clients efficiently and more professionally. As she is living in a rented house with her family, she dreams to build her own house. She also desires to increase her business and to provide a quality education to her children. Uzma and her family are very much thankful to both BRAC and Kiva.

Note: In the picture, Uzma is holding her passbook in her hand.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine and materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 38 years old, married to Kemunto, and has been blessed with three children.  He runs a mobile charging and accessories shop, and has been running the business for the last eight years. His monthly income is KES 10,000.

He is servicing his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. This loan is assisting him in purchasing more phone accessories, spare parts and associated items. He plans to use the anticipated profits to reinvest in his business and increase his inventory. 

His future dream is to have a stable business and income that will help him improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phone accessories for resale

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 26 years old and single. He has been operating a boutique business for the past year with the monthly income of KES 3,900.

He is applying for his first loan KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  Nicholas will use the loan to buy more clothes to sell at his business.

With the anticipated profit from the business he will expand his business. His hopes and dreams, in addition to expanding the business, include buying a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for his boutique

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es: Mario, es un humilde campesino, originario de la ciudad de Estelí, tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad. Elabora muebles para el hogar tales como camas, sillas, roperos, mesas de noches, cunas, gabinetes. Tiene buena clientela , este negocio le permite solventar los gastos de su hogar , ya que es el quien mantiene a su familia. El requiere el financiamiento para para comprar materia prima como lija, madera, pegamento, barniz, pintura, tornillos. Esto le ayudara a tener material de trabajo para realizar más pedidos, hacer nuevos clientes y mejorar sus ingresos, pues desea ampliar más su taller de carpintería.
texts.en: Mario is a humble country person from the city of Estelí.  He has two children, who are six and two.  He makes furniture for the home like beds, chairs, wardrobes, night tables, cribs, and cabinets.  He has a good clientele.  This business lets him take care of his home's expenses, since he is the one who supports his family.  He needs financing to buy supplies like sandpaper, wood, glue, varnish, paint, and screws.  This will help him to have materials to fill more orders, to attract new customers, and to increase his income.  He hopes to expand his carpentry shop.

loans.use: to buy supplies like sandpaper, wood, glue, varnish, paint, and screws.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
Mukaddas is married and has three small children. Her husband went to Russia to find work, and that is why she must improve her living conditions alone. Having taken the course ‘To get ahead,’ and having acquired sufficient business skills, Mukaddas wants to organize a new business sewing dresses. She will be a very successful business woman, as she is hardworking and smart.

Mukaddas is requesting a loan of 2000 somoni to buy a sewing machine to organize the new business. She is confident that her venture will be a source of income that will provide her family with a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for a new business.

loans.name: Roqiya

texts.en:
Ms. Roqiya is a hard-working 39-year-old woman. She has been in the business of machine embroidery for six years. Being the sole wage earner of her family, Roqiya is a diligent worker. She alone provides for five children, out of whom one is sent to school. 

Every day she picks her samples of embroidered clothes and visits various market places. She shows sample pieces to shop keepers who then order the desired ones. Currently she is in her second loan cycle; past records show that she is a responsible client who makes timely payments. Now she has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy reels of threads and bundles of cloth in different colors. She is hopeful that by adding this material to her range she will be able to secure more clients.

loans.use: To buy reels of threads and bundles of cloth in different colors.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 42-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as focused and creative. She operates a retail store where she sells home products such as sugar, salt, margarine, etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. 

Margaret's business is located within a fast growing urban area and her primary customers are businesspeople and residents from the neighborhood. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the sometimes low purchasing power of the customers. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more home products for resale. Her business goal is to run a supermarket within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy home products for resale.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah, a 38-year-old married mother of four children ranging in age from 2 to 18 years, describes herself as a determined woman. For the past year she has been operating a rental house as well as a poultry-selling business located within a fast-growing urban area. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her business.

Monicah will use this Kes 10,000 loan, her first with SMEP DTM, to buy more chickens to sell. Her business goal is to expand her poultry business within five years.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Nzambi

texts.en:
Nzambi is a 55-year-old businesswoman. She is married to Peter, who is a businessman. They are blessed with six children. She has been making and selling ropes for the past six years with a monthly income of KES 4,820 which she uses to support her family. 

Nzambi will use the loan to buy more sisal for making ropes. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to expand the business and improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more sisal for making ropes.

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en:
Dolly is a 37-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from three to fourteen years. She describes herself as a faithful woman. She operates a pharmacy where she sells medicine. Her business is located within a fast-growing market and her primary customers are patients from the surrounding area. 

She considers her biggest business challenge to be insufficient clean water for the patients and her family. She will use the KES 5,000 loan to buy a water purifier which she will use for her business clients and for her seven family members. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years.

loans.use: to buy a water purifier

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is from Telavi district, East Georgia. She is 35 years old and lives with her husband, two children (10 and 17 years old) and her parents-in-law. Marine’s children go to the local school. Her father-in-law is provided with a retirement pension. The family runs a small dairy farm of a milk cow, whose milk is used in dairy production. The family also has 200 sheep and produce cheese products from their milk. Marine sells her dairy products at the local market. They also sell lambs. In addition, the family owns a Georgian bakery and bakes traditional Georgian bread, which is very popular among the local population. Marine is a very hardworking woman, with a great desire to get ahead.

She requested a loan to purchase additional sheep. Marine will purchase 25 sheep and she will be able to receive more milk, produce more cheese and sell more lambs. This will significantly increase the income of the family. The increased income will be reinvested in the family agricultural business and they will expand their farm. She awaits your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Mbito

texts.en: Mbito is a married man who lives with his life partner and three children in the town of Tiribe. He has been selling cows for the last 10 years, a business that has sustained his family. In addition to this, he does farming during his free time. He is assisted by his wife who sells the farm produce both from home and through door-to-door. Mbito tells us that the business requires a lot of sacrifice and determination since the distance to the market is long. However, this does not demoralize him. He is asking for this loan to buy cows and if the money stretches, he can use the rest to invest in his farming.

loans.use: to buy two cows and seeds.

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en: Loyce is a 25-year-old married woman who has 2 children, aged 3 and 6. She describes herself as honest and committed. For the past 2 years, Loyce has operated a restaurant  where she sells food, tea and snacks. Her business is located within a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. Loyce describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of food ingredients. She will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy food ingredients to prepare meals for selling. Her goal is to expand her business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients

loans.name: Karisa

texts.en: Karisa is a 24-year-old single man who has no children yet.  He describes himself to be an honest man. For the past year, Karisa has operated a business providing motorcycle transportation services. His business is located within a productive business environment  and his primary customers are local residents. Karisa describes his biggest business challenge to be high fuel prices. He will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. Karisa's business goal is to buy three more motorcycles within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 47-year-old married woman. She has been successfully operating a business of stitching for many years. It was very difficult for Samina to feed her children when her husband was struggling hard to earn bread for his family. Her husband could not earn enough to survive. Samina started stitching clothes at her home along with her sister. She makes various designs and is famous for providing clothes on time. 


Samina is a mother of five children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands including food, health, clothing and education. Through her hard work she is able to handle her family needs and requirements effectively. It’s her second year with Kashf Foundation. She is satisfied with the support of Kashf foundation and applied for a repeat loan of Rs.15,000 to buy good quality reels of threads, buttons, zips and laces in bulk to increase her sales. She wishes to utilize part of profits on her children's education and health.

loans.use: To buy good quality reels of threads, buttons, zips and laces in bulk.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida used her previous Kiva loan to pay for her second daughter’s education. Aida has three daughters and her elder daughter is also a student. Aida’s elder daughter is a first year student in a MA course at the Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute.

Now Aida is asking for a 150000 AMD loan to pay her elder daughter’s tuition fee for the first semester.

loans.use: to pay her elder daughter’s tuition fee for her first semester.

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona, 48 years old, is from the Mtskheta district, East Georgia. She lives with her husband, three children (15, 20 and 25 years old) and her mother-in-law. Nona’s youngest child goes to the local school. Her son is a tractor driver who provides his services to local farmers for a fee. Nona’s husband is a quarry worker who earns a monthly salary. Her mother-in-law receives a retirement pension. The family runs a small dairy farm of 4 calves and 2 milk cows, whose milk is used in dairy production. Nona sells her dairy products in her village. She works hard but still doesn’t have enough income to put aside some savings and to improve the family's living conditions.

Nona has requested a loan to expand the shed for the cows. The existing one is already too small and doesn’t allow Nona to plan future expansion of the family’s farming activities. Nona will purchase construction materials for the new cattle shed. After the building is expanded, she will be able to increase the number of her cattle and dairy production. She will be able to sell at a good price, which will increase the family's income, to be reinvested in the agricultural business. All members of the family will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to expand the cow shed

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 46 years old, is a businessman who is married to Hannah, a mixed crop farmer. They are blessed with eight children. John has been a shoe maker for the past ten years, earning a monthly income of KES 8,000 which he uses to support the family. 

John is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after having being introduced by a KADET staff member. John will use the loan to buy leather materials for making shoes. He will use the anticipated profit from the business to educate his children. John's hopes and dreams are to expand the business, open a shoe selling shop and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy leather materials for making shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 36 years old, married and a mother of three children. For the last 12 years, she has earned a living by selling clothes in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of 12,000 KES.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for her third loan of 60,000 KES to buy additional stock for her business such as dresses, blouses, trousers and shirts to sell to her customers. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for her children's school fees as well as expand her business. 

Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she can help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her business such as dresses, blouses, trousers and shirts to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en: Neema is a 40-year-old, married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself to be a committed woman. Neema operates a food stall where she sells fish, charcoal and doughnuts. She has been involved in this business for 21 years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high prices of fish and charcoal. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy charcoal and fish to sell. Her business goal is to run a restaurant within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The first loan of 20,000 KES she managed to pay successfully.

loans.use: to buy more fish and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a 22-year-old businessman. He is a single man, but supports his family. He has been running an electronics shop for the past 2 years, with a monthly income of 5,160 KES which he uses to cater for his basic needs. 

He is applying for his first loan with KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Alex will use the loan to purchase more stock of electronics. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of electronics

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a single woman. She describes herself as patient and customer-friendly. She operates a retail business where she sells tea leaves. She has been involved in this business for three years. 

Her business is located in a growing business area and her primary customers are hotels and local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy tea leaves. 

Additionally, Jackline runs an M-Pesa retail store with which she adds to her business income.  Her business goal is to run another M-Pesa retail store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a family and children. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more tea leaves for selling

loans.name: Zeddy

texts.en:
Zeddy is a married woman. She has two children. One is seven years old and one is eight months old. She describes herself as God-fearing, patient and obedient. She operates a retail store where she sells items such as rice, wheat flour, sugar, sanitary towels, cooking oil, etc. She has been involved in this business for one year. 

Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her business. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more home products to sell in her store. Her business goal is to run a M-Pesa retail store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business and educate her children. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy home products

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo trabaja en las oficinas de un beneficio de café y también se dedica a producir este cultivo ya que tiene un terreno que adquirió hace algunos años. Para realizar las labores en su finca el contrata trabajadores pues le resulta imposible encargarse personalmente de ellas. La producción de Eduardo es de actualmente cinco toneladas las cuales entrega en su totalidad a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” para que sean procesadas y exportadas. Para la siguiente cosecha Eduardo necesita realizar algunas labores de limpieza y preparación de su terreno para poder sembrar más planta y para eso solicita un crédito el cual pagará al final de la cosecha. La meta de Eduardo es que dentro de tres años sus fincas estén produciendo un total de ocho toneladas ya sí aumentar sus ingresos. En el plano personal a Eduardo le gustaría poder brindarle a sus dos hijos la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en: Eduardo works in the offices of a coffee processing plant and also makes a living producing this crop since he has land that he acquired some years ago.  In order to carry out the work on his farm he hires workers as it proves to be impossible for him to personally take care of all of it.  Eduardo's production is currently five tons which he delivers in its entirety to the Regional Union of Huatusco so that it is processed and exported.  For the next harvest Eduardo needs to carry out some cleaning work and preparation of his land in order to plant more plants and for this he is applying for a loan which he will repay at the end of the harvest.  Eduardo’s goal is that within three years his farms are producing a total of eight tons that will increase his income.  On a personal level, Eduardo would like to be able to provide his two children the opportunity to study a professional career.

loans.use: to clean and prepare his land to plant new coffee plants.

loans.name: Mehwish

texts.en:
Ms. Mehwish is a 22-year-old, energetic lady who started a beauty parlor in a small corner of her two-room house two years ago.  She works hard day and night to make her parlor famous so that she may be able to provide her family with a better standard of living.  

Mehwish works tirelessly to keep the business running because she is the only bread winner of the house.  The entire family depends on her since none of her siblings are old enough to work themselves.  

It was getting extremely difficult for Mehwish to manage her family, as the parlor was running on minimum necessities and her clients were hesitant to use her services since there are a lot of competitors in the community.  That is why Mehwish is taking out a loan worth Rs 25,000 from Kashf that she will use to buy more cosmetics and some furniture for the parlor.  

She is hopeful that she will have more clients in the coming days, and intends to utilize the earned revenue on the expansion of her business and the well-being of her family members.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and furniture for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Dulce Maria

texts.es:
Doña Dulce es una persona honesta, responsable y trabajadora, vive con su esposo y su hijo en una colonia al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es una glorieta.
Doña Dulce el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de: refrescos, pollo, carnes y condimentos etc. Con el préstamo ella espera que sus ventas aumenten ya que al tener más productos que ofrecer a los clientes que a diario la visitan y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos, sus ingresos mejoraran.
Doña Dulce en el futuro ella desea que su negocio sea más grande y fuerte para poder seguir apoyando a su familia.
Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre 2012
texts.en:
Dulce is an honest, responsible, and hardworking person. She lives with her husband and her son in a town in the south of Honduras. Her business is a small restaurant.

Dulce needs the loan to buy: soft drinks, chicken, meats, and condiments, etc. She hopes that with the loan her sales will increase. By having more products to offer her daily customers and being able to cover their needs, her income will improve. 

In the future Dulce hopes that her business will be bigger and stronger so that she can continue supporting her family.

Choluteca, Honduras – September 2012

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, chicken, meats, and condiments, ect. for her business.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael, 58 years old, is a businessman who is married to Josephine, a mixed crop farmer. They are blessed with five children. Michael has operated a livestock trading business for the past six years, earning a monthly income of KES 11,400 which he uses to support the family. 

Michael is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, having repaid the previous loan successfully. Michael will use the loan to purchase more goats and sheep to sell. He will use the anticipated profit from the business to educate his children. Michael's hope and dream is to buy a pickup for transporting the livestock to the nearby markets.

loans.use: to purchase more goats and sheep

loans.name: Gard

texts.en: Gard is a shrewd young man who saw himself into the cattle trade at a tender age to prepare for his family's future early enough. He was subjected to severe poverty during his childhood and he does not want the same to befall his children. He is still challenged by limited capital as well as grazing land, but he hopes he will be able to accumulate some funds to buy more land and buy enough cows to transport to the city. Gard will achieve this dream with the help of loans. He is very shrewd and persevering.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, aged 55, is a farmer in the Nkubu area of Kenya, where she lives with her husband and three of their children, one of whom attends school. Rose has been farming for the last fifteen years, producing maize, beans and bananas, which she sells locally.

Rose is requesting a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy irrigation equipment to boost her production and business, which will help her take her children through college. Rose's business challenges include pests, diseases and a poor market. She says she appreciates the way Juhudi Kilimo offers loans which are affordable to small scale farmers.

loans.use: To purchase irrigation equipment

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is a 19-year-old, single man. He describes himself to be a business-oriented young man and a social man. He operates a motorcycle where he provides transportation services. Abubakar has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located along a busy road and his primary customers are local residents from the environs and businesspeople. He describes his biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. 

Abubakar will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. His business goal is to buy 10 more motorcycles within 5 years. In addition, he runs a retail kiosk where he sells home products.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Urunzi

texts.en: Urunzi is a 39-year-old, married man. He has 5 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 16 years. He describes himself to be a God-fearing and business-oriented man. Urunzi operates a motorcycle where he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for 1 year. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. His business goal is to buy a taxi within 5 years. In addition, Urunzi runs a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: John

texts.en: John, 35 years old, is married and has 3 children whose ages range from 4 to 12 years. He describes himself as visionary. John operates a food stall  where he sells cereals. He has been involved in this business for 22 years and employs 2 staff members. His business is located within a busy market and his primary customers are local residents. John describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving his business. He will use this KES 12,900 loan to buy a solar lamp to be used by his family members. John's business goal is to run a wholesale business within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Tumate

texts.en:
Tumate is 32 years old, married and has been blessed with four children that he supports. He is a livestock keeper in Narok area and has been in livestock farming for the last eight years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

He is taking his first loan of KES.30,000 from KADET LTD, with which he plans to purchase more livestock for fattening and resale.

He intends to use the anticipated profits to add to his number of animals, and to pay school fees for his kids. His future dream is to prosper and improve his family’s living standards

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 35-year-old, married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be a determined man. Stephen operates a bicycle where he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a potential business environment and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a poor road network . He will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy another bicycle. His business goal is to buy a motorcycle within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy another bicycle

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela is a 46-year-old woman. She has 7 children. She describes herself to be a hardworking woman. Pamela operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits. Her business is located in a busy market and her primary customers are daily consumers from the environs. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough stock for selling to customers. She will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy more vegetables and fruits for selling. Her business goal is to expand her business into a bigger grocery store within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children with profits made. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits for sale

loans.name: Andres Epifanio

texts.es: Andrés Epifanio de 42 anos de edad. Del municipio de Malpaisillo, casado con dos hijos de  17, 15 anos los dos están estudiando en secundaria. Tiene por actividad económica la venta de combustible, lubricantes y repuesto de bicicletas. Desde hace  8 anos que inicio dicha actividad. La cual inicio con esfuerzo propio y por la necesidad de tener un ingresos para su familia y aprovechando que la comarca donde habita no prestaban el servicio. El cual tuvo una gran aceptación y de dicha forma se estableció y en la actualidad tiene mucha clientela. Andrés ya ha trabajado con otros créditos y ha demostrado su responsabilidad con sus pagos en tiempo y formas. El financiamiento lo quiere para invertir en capital de trabajo y  comprar sus productos  como: combustible, repuesto de bicicletas, llantas, frenos, pedal, rayos, grasa. Andrés agradece la ayuda que brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recurso para poder tener un medio de trabajo digno en países con tanta carencias como es Nicaragua.
texts.en: Andrés Epifanio is 42 years old. He is from the municipality of Malpaisillo, married, and has two children who are 17 and 15 years old and who are studying in high school. His business is the sale of fuel, lubricants, and replacement bicycle parts. He started in this business 8 years ago. He started it of his own initiative because he needed an income for his family. He took advantage of the fact that in the town where he lives, no one else provided this service. His business was well accepted, so he became established and now he has many customers. Andrés has had other loans in the past and he has demonstrated his responsibility by making his repayments on schedule. He needs the loan to invest in working capital and to buy products such as: fuel, bicycle parts, tires, brakes, pedals, spokes, and grease. Adrés is thankful for the help that the Kiva lenders provide to people of few financial resources so that they can have a dignified way of working in countries with so many needs, like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to buy products such as: fuel, bicycle parts, tires, brakes, pedals, spokes, and grease.

loans.name: Al-Wafa(Thwra) Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-wafa (Thwra), which consists of four ladies and one man who live in Sana`a, Yemen.

Egbal is a 31-year-old, married woman and has two children who live in Sana`a, Yemen. She works hard to support the family money-wise. She is a tailor where she receives customers at her place. She started her business with embroidering ladies' fabrics that she learned sewing. She’s a brave woman who is running a business while at the same time raising her children and taking care of her house. She has operated her business for only one year. 

With her requested loan from AMB, she will purchase a new sewing machine so as to better serve her clients. She hopes her business will grow to get more profit and help her family to offer a good life.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.en:
Apolinar is 54 years old. He is from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. He has been a rice farmer for 35 years. Apolinar also raises hogs for an income. All his children are grown, but he continues to work hard on his farm so he can save for old age.

The previous harvest season has been good to him, and Apolinar is looking forward to a better income this time around. He applied for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his crops and feed for his hogs. These will prevent his crops from certain pests that will lessen his crop’s yield and the feed will fatten his hogs. He hopes to have a better profit out of his farming so he can buy some things for his house. The additional income will go to savings and nutritious meals for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his crops and feed for his hogs

loans.name: Al-Rnin Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-rnin, which is comprised of five women. They applied for a loan of 150,000 YER. 

Yasmin lives in Hodiedh, Yemen. She is 39 years old, married and doesn't have children. She is the woman seated in the middle in the photo. For 2 years, Yasmin has worked selling different clothes. She is a professional in this field, that her goods are required for clients. She started her business with small capital.

Yasmin is applying for a loan of 30,000 YER to buy dresses, pants, shirts and other clothes. Her extra income from the loan will improve her living standards. Her dream is to expand her business and open a clothing store for resale.

loans.use: to buy dresses, pants, shirts and other clothes for resale.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia farms rice to support her family. They live in Bien Unido, a town in Bohol province. Lucia and her husband help each other to till the land, hoping for a good harvest. Lucia has applied for a loan to acquire seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. With this loan, Lucia and her husband can expect a better yield on their crops because they have the means to buy the needed supplies for farming maintenance. Any income derived from this business will be spent on the family’s daily consumption and future business investments. Lucia has four children whose ages range from 18 to 30.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, a 48-year-old married mother of two children, has been raising pigs in the Philippines for four years now. Having borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF and more recently from Kiva to sustain her business, she is requesting a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Evelyn is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Erick Antonio

texts.es: Erick Antonio de  39 anos de edad del municipio de la Paz Centro, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. La Paz Centro es un lugar que se caracteriza por sus trabajos artesanales hecho de barro, y sus comidas típica como quesillos, tiste, chicha. Erick es  casado con dos hijos de 17, 5 anos. La actividad económica de Erick es Sastre, desde hace 15 anos que se dedica a dicha actividad la cual consiste en elaborar prendas de vestir como camisas, pantalones chores, trajes esmoquin de hombre. Erick ya ha trabajado con fundación y ha demostrado ser responsable, trabajador, buena paga en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar telas variadas  para ofrecer mejor servicio a su clientela. El sr. Agradece la que los prestamista kiva le brindan a los pequeños comerciantes de bajo recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Erick Antonio, from the city of La Paz Centro, is 39 years old. La Paz Centro is located in the western part of the country, and is known for its handicrafts made from clay and its traditional foods like quesillos [corn tortillas topped with cheese, cream, and pickled onions], tiste, and chicha [both corn-based drinks]. 

Erick is married with two children who are 17 and 5 years old. He earns a living as a tailor. He has worked in that business for 15 years, making garments such as shirts, pants, shorts, and men's suits. Erick has already worked with Fundación Leon and has shown himself to be responsible, hardworking, and reliable in making his payments according to their terms and timeline. He needs this loan to invest in working capital and to buy various fabrics so that he can offer better service to his clientele. He is grateful for what the Kiva lenders offer to small business owners with limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and buy various fabric to make garments.

loans.name: Gladis Estela

texts.es:
Doña Gladis es una persona honesta, trabajadora y responsable, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en una Colonia al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es una Ferretería.
Doña Gladis el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de: cemento, madera, herramientas, y otros materiales de construcción para su negocio, Con el préstamo ella espera que sus ventas aumenten al tener más producto para cubrir los pedidos de los clientes le hacen a diario a su negocio, así mismo poder mejorar el estilo de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar.
Doña Gladis en el futuro ella espera contar con un mejor espacio físico para poder vender varillas para la construcción ya que en los momentos no cuenta con este y poder seguir apoyando a la familia y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y se conviertan en persona de bien y con mejores oportunidades.
Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre 2012
texts.en:
Gladis is an honest, hardworking, and responsible person. She lives with her husband and their 3 children in a town in southern Honduras. Her business is a hardware store.

Gladis needs the loan to buy cement, wood, tools, and other construction materials for her business. She expects that with the loan her sales will increase since she’ll have more products to cover the needs of her daily customers. The increase in income will allow her to improve her family’s standard of living.

In the future, Gladis hopes to have and improved physical space so that she can sell rebar for construction, which she can’t do at the moment. She also hopes to continue supporting her family and for her children to finish their studies so they can become successful people with better opportunities.

Choluteca, Honduras – September 2012

loans.use: to buy cement, wood, tools and other construction materials for her business.

loans.name: Emilene

texts.en: Emilene is a farmer from the community of San Miguel, Bohol. She is 48 years old, married to a farmer and carpenter. They have three children, ages 15, 24 and 26. Emilene is working hard so that she can provide for her family’s needs. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pay for school fees of her child. She hopes that with the help of the loan, she will be more productive in her farming and she will be able to have a good harvest. In the future, Emilene plans to have a bigger farm to earn more.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for school fees of her child

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a married woman and a mother of two children, ages 11 and 7. She is engaged in a farming business. Also, she is making baskets out of "buri" (native palm) and selling them in the market.

Marieta is in need of a loan. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer for the plants and materials for basket-making.

Marieta hopes that she will be successful in her business someday so that she can support her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the plants and materials for basket-making

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a 55-year-old, married woman and a mother of 5 grown children from Antequera, Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in a basket-making business. She also has other ventures such as food vending and selling cosmetics products.

Leonora is in need of an additional loan for her business. With a loan, Leonora will be able to buy materials such as buri for basket-making and cooking ingredients for her food-vending business.

In the future, Leonora dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy materials such as buri for her basket-making and cooking ingredients for her food-vending business

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita hails from San Miguel, Bohol. She is 58 years old and relies on farming for a living. Her farming has been existent for 40 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and a sprayer. She wants to increase her income so she can buy the basic needs of her household, like healthy meals and paying for electricity. Any additional income will be for savings and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and a sprayer

loans.name: Martha Segunda

texts.es: Martha  está muy feliz porque con su credikiva compró una máquina industrial y hasta le alcanzó para comprar materias primas e insumos, como telas, hilos, rellenos y una máquina de coser. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva,  con el cual comprará telas de toda clase por rollos, hilos, y rellenos  en un  volumen que le facilita el obtener descuentos especiales por compras de contado y en mayor cantidad; con su  producción satisfará las necesidades de su clientela y por eso Martha pide a sus financiadores en Kiva,  que sigan apoyando a los microempresarios, porque con los financiamientos están llevando a cabo sus sueños con los créditos.
texts.en: Martha is very happy because with her Kiva loan she bought an industrial machine and it was even enough to buy raw materials and supplies like cloth, threads, stuffing and a sewing machine.  At present she is applying for a Kiva loan with which she will buy all kinds of fabric by the roll, thread and stuffing in a volume that makes it easy for her to get special discounts for purchases in cash and in great quantity.  With her production she will satisfy the needs of her customers.  That's why Martha asks the lenders on Kiva to continue supporting small businesses, because with the financing they are carrying out their dreams.

loans.use: to buy all kinds of fabric by the roll, thread and stuffing in a greater volume.

loans.name: Militona

texts.en: Militona, 48 years old, is married and has six children between the ages of 9 and 26. She and her husband are engaged in farming rice and raising hogs. Militona has been growing rice for more than 10 years, and she works hard to help sustain her family's needs. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and feed for her hogs. Militona hopes that this loan will pave the way to uplift the family's present living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and feed

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita, 53 years old, is married and has 3 children, one of whom is in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Anita has been raising pigs for 28 years and has previously borrowed 10 times from NWTF to sustain it. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Anita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en: Amelita is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 15 years, she has operated a business buying and selling charcoal/firewood in the Philippines. Amelita has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell. Amelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Merle

texts.en:
Merle, 39 years old, is married and has three children, ages 16, 13 and 12. They live in Antequera, Bohol, Philippines. Merle has been engaged in a food vending business for several years and also has a basket making venture.

Merle needs a loan for the expansion of her business. She will use the loan to buy materials for making baskets and ingredients for her food vending business. In the future, Merle hopes to make her business a success and to support her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy materials for making baskets and ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 56 years old and married, with children aged 19 to 28 years.  Her family lives in San Miguel, Bohol. 

She and her husband are farmers.  They grow rice for a living. She is determined to help make their farming business a success. She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers called Atlas 14-14-14 and Urea. These two types of fertilizer are very important in rice farming. 

She hopes for their farm to be more successful during the harvest season, giving them a better return of investment.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for their rice fields.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a basket-weaving business in the Philippines.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy materials for her basket-weaving business.  She has been in this business for 11 years.

In the future, Fe would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her basket-weaving business.

loans.name: Maria Candelaria

texts.es: La señora María Candelaria es madre soltera y trabaja en una farmacia de la localidad como despachadora de mostrador, tiene un segundo ingreso como empleada domestica y vive en una casa de interés social desde hace 12 años; con el paso de los años su casa se ha ido deteriorando las paredes ya están cuarteadas y cuando llueve la humedad entra a su casa y los muebles que tiene se le están dañando. Candelaria solicita el apoyo para levantar cimientos más fuertes en su casa y así evitar daños a sus bienes y poder brindar a sus hijos un hogar seguro.
texts.en: María Candelaria is a single mother and works in a local pharmacy as a sales clerk. She has a second income as a domestic worker. She has lived in a government-subsidized house for 12 years. With the passage of time, her house has been deteriorating. The walls are cracked and when it rains the dampness gets in the house, which is causing damage to her furniture. Candelaria is requesting support to build stronger foundations for her house so that she can prevent damage to her property and also provide her children with a safe home.

loans.use: to build a stonger foundation for her house

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en:
Adelia works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. Adelia requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

In the future, Adelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 8 years. Ma. Gina earns more income from her videoke rentals business.

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business. Ma. Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Zyra

texts.en:
Zyra is 24 years old and married, with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Zyra has a variety store business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional items such as rice, snacks, and other groceries.

Zyra has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase items such as rice, snacks, and other groceries.

loans.name: Angelis

texts.en:
Angelis works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Angelis requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.  She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Angelis would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita works hard to support her three children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Clarita requested a 1800 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a backup light in case of an emergency.

Clarita is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money—she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 42 years old and married with four children. Remedios works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items like soda, bread and other grocery items.

Remedios has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from her food-vending business. Remedios aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like soda, bread and other grocery items.

loans.name: Cidel Marie

texts.en: Cidel Marie, 42 years old, is married and has 7 children, 5 of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 6 years, Cidel Marie has operated a business buying and selling bamboo in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more bamboo to sell to her customers. In the future, Cidel Marie would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo to sell

loans.name: Alba Marina

texts.es: Alba Marina de 57 anos de edad, casada con 2 hijos mayores de edad de 32,29 anos  e independiente. Esta Sra. es del departamento de León que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Alba tiene por actividad económica un librería ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace  33 anos que tiene experiencia en el mismo. Alba María ya ha trabajado con fundación león 2000 y ha demostrado su responsabilidad y ganas de seguir adelante porque se ha visto el crecimiento de su negocio y además es excelente paga en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar productos de librería como: cuadernos, lápices, marcadores, crayolas, libretas, folder, resma de papel carta, y legal, borradores, reglas, cartucheras entre otros. Alba Marina agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escaso recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para que tener un medio de trabajo digno por la falta de fuente de trabajo en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Alba Marina is 57 years old and married with two adult children who are 32 and 29 years old and live independently. She is from the department of León, which is located in the western part of the country. Alba has been earning her living running a stationery store in her home for 33 years. Alba Marina has already worked with Fundación León 2000 and has shown her responsibility and desire to get ahead; her business has shown growth and she has an excellent loan payment history.

She needs this loan to invest in working capital and to buy stationery products like notebooks, pencils, markers, crayons, composition books, folders, reams of letter- and legal-size paper, erasers, rulers, and pencil cases, among others. Because of the lack of work in her country, Alba Marina is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders offer to people with limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent livelihood.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her stationery store with products like notebooks, pencils, markers, crayons, composition books, folders, reams of letter- and legal-size paper, erasers, rulers, and pencil cases.

loans.name: Maria Lucrecia

texts.es:
Doña María es una señora trabajadora, responsable y honesta vive con sus hijos en la comunidad de La Chorrera al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la compra y venta de ganado.
Doña María el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de ganado. Con el préstamo ella espera tener más ganado que ofrecer y así aumentar las ventas  y a su vez con los ingresos obtenidos mejorar el estilo de vida y el de su familia.
Doña María en el futuro ella espera que su negocio crezca y sea el más conocido de este rubro y con esto seguir apoyando a su familia a que puedan vivir de una manera mucho mejor.
Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre 2012
texts.en:
María is a hardworking, responsible, and honest person. She lives with her children in the community of La Chorrera, in the south of Honduras. Her business is the buying and selling of cattle. 

María needs the loan to buy cattle. With the loan she expects to have more cattle to offer and this will increase her sales. The income obtained will improve her and her family’s standard of living.
