For the future, María hopes that her business will grow and that she will be the best-known person in this business so that she can continue supporting her family so that they can live a much better life. 

Choluteca, Honduras - September 2012

loans.use: to buy cattle for her business

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en: Narcisa and her husband live in Trinidad, a town in Bohol known for farming businesses. Narcisa has been working hard in her farming business for nine years to support her 8 children who are now mostly adults. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings. Business profitability is her main goal so she can support her family's basic needs, such as food and electricity. In the future, Narcisa hopes to expand her business and to be more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 56 years old and married, with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Elsa has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other equipment.

She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Elsa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Lesya

texts.ru:
Леся - предприниматель из города Бердычекв. Ей 32 года, замужем, имеет двоих детей. Когда закончила институт, по специальности работала не долго, потом по совету знакомых пошла торговать на рынок реализатором. Торговала женским бельем а в последствии сама начала работать на себя и открыла собственную торговую точку на заработанные деньги.

Леся просит предоставить ей кредит на закупку осенних женских колгот. Как предприниматель Леся старается развиваться и расти, не боится трудностей.
texts.en: Lecya is an entrepreneur from the city of Berdichev. She is 32 years old, married and has two children. When she graduated from her institute, she worked in her trained profession for a short period of time. Then, on the advice of her friends, she began to work at the market as a retail end seller. She sold women's undergarments and subsequently began to work for herself, opening her own retail store on her earnings. Lecya is requesting a loan for the purchase of women's tights for the fall. As an entrepreneur, Lecya strives to develop and grow, unafraid of difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase women's tights for the fall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair his taxi.

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.es: El Señor Cornelio de 41 es casado y padre de familia vive en una casa de interés social desde  hace doce años, trabaja en una maquiladora de la localidad como supervisor del área de producción; el tiene dos metas a por las cuales ha trabajado durante mucho tiempo la primera de ellas es poderles dar una carrera profesional a sus hijos ya que para él fue muy difícil el tener que cursar únicamente la educación primaria porque en su hogar había la necesidad de que el trabajara y desde muy chico él se trazo la meta que cuando él tuviera sus propios hijos iba a trabajar día y noche para que ellos pudieran terminar una carrera y así lo está haciendo. La otra meta que tiene es brindarle a su familia un  lugar digno donde vivir, el motivo es porque el de niño sufrió muchas carencias como las inclemencias del tiempo mucho frio y mucho calor  el no tener su propio espacio. Solicita el apoyo para levantar un cuarto en la parte de atrás de su casa y así poder brindar a sus hijos lo que el no tuvo una habitación para que tengan su propio espacio.
texts.en: Cornelio is 41 years old, married, and a father. He has lived in a in a government-subsidized house for 12 years. He works in a local factor as a production supervisor. He has two goals that he has worked towards for a long time. One of them is to be able to give his children professional careers. Things were difficult for him since he only finished primary school, because his family needed him to work from the time he was very young. He set this goal when he had his own children. He went to work day and night so that they could finish their studies, and he is still doing this. His other goal is to provide his family with a dignified place to live. His motivation is that when he was a boy he suffered many discomforts due to a lack of resources, such as bad weather, cold, excessive heat, and not having his own space. He is requesting a loan to build another room on the back side of his house so that he can provide his children with what he didn’t have—a room so that they can have their own space.

loans.use: to begin building a room onto his house.

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es:
Don Fausto es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive con  su esposa y sus 3 hijos en la comunidad  de la Chorrera al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es una pulpería.
Don Fausto el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de: maíz, arroz, manteca, frijoles, pan, queso, mantequilla, azúcar, refrescos, café, etc. Con el préstamo espera aumentar las ventas al tener más productos  que ofrecer a los clientes que lo visitan a diario, al igual con los ingresos mejorar el estilo de vida de la familia y el hogar.
Don Fausto en el futuro espera que su negocio crezca hasta convertirse  en un mini mercadito y seguir apoyando a su familia  y a sus hijos a terminar  sus estudios y que se conviertan en personas de bien  y con mejores oportunidades.
Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre 2012
texts.en: Don Fausto is a responsible, hardworking person who lives with his wife and three children in the community of Chorrera in the south of Honduras.  He owns a corner store.  Don Fausto needs this loan to buy corn, rice, lard, beans, bread, cheese, butter, sugar, drinks, coffee, etc.  With the loan, he hopes to increase his sales by having more products to offer the customers who visit daily.  This will allow him to better the lifestyle of his family and household.  In the future, Don Fausto hopes that his business grows enough to become a small grocery store so he can continue to support his family and children through their schooling, which will allow them to have better opportunities.  Choluteca, Honduras - September 2012

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, lard, beans, bread, cheese, butter, sugar, drinks, coffee, etc for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise (tee shirts, sweaters, shorts, pants, and blouses, among other garments).

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru: Наталья предыдущий кредит выплатила без проблем. В этот раз хочет взять кредит на покупку резиновых сапог для фермеров. Для Натальи начинаются хорошие торговые месяца осенью; летом были трудности со спросом на ее товар. Сейчас осенняя погода приводит ее покупателя из ферм. Наталья также планирует закупку утепленных сапог для рыбаков и сторожей.
texts.en: Natalya paid off her previous loan without any problems. This time, she would like to take out a loan for the purchase of rubber boots for farmers. For Natalya, the the fall months kick off good sales; in the summer there were difficulties with demand for her product. Now the fall weather brings her customers from the farms. Natalya also plans to purchase warm boots for fishermen and guards.

loans.use: to purchase farmer's boots

loans.name: Diosdado

texts.en:
Diosdado is a 53 year old and married, the father to six children.  He lives in Antequera, Bohol, Philippines. 

He is engaged in the motorcycle transport business. He uses his motorcycle to transport passengers from one place to another.

Diosdado is asking for a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy fuel and spare parts for the motorcycle. This loan would be a great help for him in improving his daily earning from his motorcycle.

In the future, Diosdado hopes of making his business a success.  In addition, he plans to invest in some business to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy fuel and spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

NWTF is relisting Loreta's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 53 years old from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married, with four adult children. 

For 12 years now, she has been dependent on her seaweed farming business to provide for her family's needs. She is asking for a loan so she can sustain the needs of the business. It will be used to buy plastic straw, gasoline, and rice. The straw will be used like a fence for the seaweed, gasoline for the boat, and rice for her family's consumption.

In the future, she hopes that her business will improve, so she can have a better income and provide her family a healthy diet and savings for old age.

loans.use: to buy plastic straw, gasoline, and rice

loans.name: Las Maravillas S.b. Group

texts.es:
La señora Domitila, tiene 60 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio el Nispero, Santa Bárbara. Doña Domitila tiene 40 años de dedicarse a realizar actividades de artesanías, donde elabora petates, carteras, bolsos, monederos, alfombras, naturales y decorados, hechos de material tule y también trabajos en junco. La producción la vende en el mercado local de la zona y se expande a otros mercados de otras ciudades. Este negocio lo realiza en su casa y tiene buena demanda ya que hay turismo en la zona. Para mantener este negocio ha solicitado a ODEF varios préstamos, con el actual lleva cuatro ciclos, y lo va invertir en la compra de materia prima principalmente el tule que utiliza para elaborar sus productos y pago de mano de obra a las personas que le ayudan en el negocio. Ella tiene metas de tener un negocio más grande para crecer e incrementar sus ganancias. 
Ella pertenece al Grupo solidario Las Maravillas S.B. que está formado de tres miembros que se dedican a la misma actividad y viven en la misma comunidad. En la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda esta Delia de blusa color rojo, seguidamente esta Domitila y a la derecha esta Reina de blusa color morado. El total del préstamo grupal es por 45,000 Lempiras.
texts.en:
Domitila is 60 years old. She is married, has two children, and lives in the municipality of Nispero, Santa Bárbara. For 40 years, Domitila has been engaged in handicrafts work, where she makes sleeping mats, wallets, bags, change purses, plain and decorated rugs; all made of tule reeds, as well  junco reed work. She sells her output in the local market in the area, and is expanding to sell in other markets in other cities. 

She carries on this business from her home, and has good demand, as there is tourism in the area. To keep this business going, she has applied to ODEF for several loans. This is her fourth loan, and she is going to invest it in the purchase of raw material, mainly the tule reeds that she uses to make her products, as well as to pay for the labor of the people who help her in the business. Her goal is to have a larger business, in order to grow, and increase her earnings. 

She belongs to the "Las Maravillas" solidarity group, which is made up of three members who work in the same activity and live in the same community.  

In the photo, the members can be identified as follows: on the left is Delia with a red blouse, next to her is Domitila, and on the right is Reina, wearing a purple blouse. The total of the group loan is 45,000 lempiras.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as tule reeds, and pay for labor for the making of handicrafts.

loans.name: Maria

texts.ru:
Мария торгует продуктами питания на продуктовом рынке. Мария просит предоставить ей кредит на увеличение ассортимента товара. Она надеется, что она сможет удержать старых и привлечь новых покупателей.

Недавно у Марии заболела дочь, были проблемы с глазом. Для Марии это было особое переживание как для матери, но все обошлось хорошо.
texts.en:
Maria sells food products at the produce market. Maria is requesting a loan for the expansion of her product variety. She hopes to be able to retain old customers and attract new customers. 

Not long ago, Maria's daughter fell ill with an eye condition. For Maria, it was a particularly trying experience as a mother, but everything turned out alright.

loans.use: to increase her assortment of goods.

loans.name: Rufina Ancelma

texts.es:
Rufina es una mujer de 40 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus 5 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos no pudo culminar sus estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta compartir gratos momentos con sus hijos y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines Rojos para engreírlos.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación Rufina puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de verduras y abarrotes, ella cuenta con un espacio en su vivienda, el cual utiliza para realizar sus ventas, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por la variedad de productos que ofrece y porque no tiene mucha competencia en su zona. 
Rufina se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como: arroz, azúcar, menestras, aceite, fideos, leche, etc.; de esta manera Rufina tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, así ella espera aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que pueda asegurar la educación y bienestar de sus pequeños, ya que su gran sueño es verlos convertidos en buenos profesionales y en hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Rufina is a woman who is 40 years old and lives in the city of Nazca with her five children, whom she loves and are the main reason in her life. She is a very kind person, hard-working and enthusiastic, who devotes all her efforts to get her family ahead. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and for the need to work to cover her expenses, she was unable to complete secondary studies. But she would have liked to do it. In her free time, she likes to share great moments with her children and sometimes she cooks delicious Tallarines Rojos to spoil them. 

With much effort and dedication, Rufina launched her small business selling vegetables and groceries. She has a space in her home, which she uses to make the sales. Every day from early morning she starts working. She can work an estimated of ten hours and believes she is doing well due to the variety of products she offers and because she doesn't have a lot of competition in the area. 

Rufina is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help provided she will be able to buy merchandise for her business such as rice, sugar, vegetables, oil, noodles, milk, etc. Thus, Rufina will have her business better stocked. She expects to increase her sales and income, which will serve to ensure the education and welfare of her children. Her dream is to see them become good professionals and good men.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, vegetables, oil, noodles, milk, etc.

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
Vidal tiene 31 años de edad, el vive en la ciudad de Camaná, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la pesa y la agricultura en especial el cultivo de arroz. Vidal vive al lado de su esposa con la cual tiene 1 pequeño de 5 años de edad, a que quiere muchísimo y por el cual trabaja muy duro para poder sacarlo adelante, ya que quiere que sea una persona de bien. }Vidal es muy trabajador, pero cuando tiene un tiempito disponible le encanta ir de pesca y sobre todo comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Chupe de camarones”. Con mucha tristeza Vidal nos cuenta que el solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado tener una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Vidal trabaja como albañil, el labora alrededor de 10 horas al día, ya que el construir tiene su tiempo, nos comenta vidal, a él le gusta lo que hace y por ello el cree que le va bien, porque es detallista y cumplido con los clientes.

Vidal está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá  realizar mejoras en su vivienda, el podrá refaccionar las paredes, componer la puerta de su vivienda y colocar lunas, ya que actualmente sus ventanas son de platico, así el podrá ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y luchar por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Poder darle una buena educación a su hijo y comprar una motocarga”.
texts.en:
Vidal is 31 years old and lives in Camana, a city characterized by its warm climate as well as its fishing and agriculture, especially the growing of rice.  Vidal lives with his wife with whom he has one son, who is five years old and who he loves very much.  He wants his son to have opportunities, so Vidal works very hard to be able to help his son be successful.  

Vidal is very hardworking, but when he has some free time he likes to go fishing and above all, eat one of his favorite dishes which is the very tasty "Chupe de camarones" (shrimp chowder).  

With much sadness, Vidal confesses that he only finished part of his high school education, though he would have like to have a university degree.  Day by day, Vidal is a builder, working nearly 10 hours a day.  Despite occupying so much of his time, Vidal enjoys his work and he believes he does well because he is detail-oriented and polite with his customers.  

Vidal is very appreciative of Kiva loans because thanks to them he will be able to make improvements to his home.  He will be able to refurbish the walls, repair the front door, and put in windows (currently, his windows are made of plastic).  He will be able to offer a better quality of life to his family as well as fight to make his greatest dream a reality which is to give his son a good education and to buy a small pickup truck.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is from the community of Bien Unido. This town has abundant fishing activity. And like others, Herminia relies on this livelihood for an income. She also farms seaweed and produces dried fish to resell. Her business has been thriving for 7 years now. 

Herminia is asking for a loan to buy plastic rope and fishing nets that are necessary for her business. Her profit will provide a healthy diet for her 7 children ages 16-28. In the future, she hopes to have another business so she can have an increased revenue.

loans.use: to buy plastic rope and fishing nets.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 22 years old. She is married with 3 children ages 1, 2, and 4. She and her husband have been farming seaweed for an income for 4 years now. She is working hard in her business to provide decent shelter for her family. 

Jasmin is asking for a loan to buy seaweed seedlings, plastic rope, cement, and galvanized iron for her house. She hopes that while her children are still young, she can renovate her house and provide them a better future through education.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, plastic rope, cement, and galvanized iron.

loans.name: Peligrina

texts.en:
Peligrina runs a sari-sari or convenience store in Antequera, Bohol, Philippines. She has been in this business for more than 2 years. She sells various kinds of goods to the people in the community.

Peligrina is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell in her store such as noodles, canned goods, biscuits and other snack foods, soap, shampoo, etc.

In the future, Peligrina wants to expand her business and make it more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell in her store such as noodles, canned goods, biscuits and other snack foods, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Nelsie

texts.en:
Nelsie and her husband are engaged in fishing as their source of income. She is 29 years old and has 6 children ages 2 months to 12 years old. She works with her husband and sells his catch at the market. 

Nelsie is asking for a loan so she can improve their business and be more productive in their fishing. She will use her loan to buy a fishing net, gasoline, and rice. She hopes to have a stable income that will give her children a chance for a good education.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, gasoline, and rice.

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en: Khalid is 33 years old, married and has 3 children. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has a bus that he has owned for one year. He defines himself as a hard worker who is determined to get ahead through a great spirit of progress. He works daily to get home expenses. He would like to buy spare parts for his bus. So, he requested a loan of 149,999.94 YER from AMB to buy a machine for his care. He hopes to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a machine for his care.

loans.name: Hamid

texts.en: Hamid is a happy man who treats everyone well because of his opportunities to get ahead. He has had a bus since 2003. He lives with his one child in Sana'a, Yemen. Previously, he worked as a driver on a bus. He owns a bus and works hard to earn his family's expenses. So he applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to buy a machine for his bus.

loans.use: to buy a machine for his bus.

loans.name: Ma. Rebecca

texts.en: Ma. Rebecca is a 27-year-old married woman and a mother of three young children, ages 7, 4 and 2 years old. She has been engaged in basket-making for seven years now. Ma. Rebecca works hard to earn a living to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. Ma. Rebecca is asking for a loan to buy materials, such as "buri" (a native palm) and others, to make baskets. In the future Ma. Rebecca hopes to make her business a success. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy basket-making materials, such as buri and others.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda is 38 years old, married with three children, ages 1, 14 and 15. She is a seaweed farmer and has relied on this business for an income for more than 10 years now. Her husband is a fisherman and also farms seaweed. She is asking for a loan so she can continue to improve her business and provide for her family's needs. She will invest her loan to buy fishing nets and seaweed seedlings. She hopes that someday she can improve her family's life status through the income that she generates from this business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and seaweed seedlings.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 46 years old and a farmer in the Nkubu area of  Kenya, where he lives with his wife and their four children.  Two are attending school.  

He has been in farming for 30 years, producing milk, coffee, tea, and cereals, which he sells at the local market.  He has a retail shop as an additional source of income.

Patrick is requesting a loan of KES 30,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to buy water tanks and pipes to irrigate his crops.  That will help him get more produce and income that in turn will help educate his children. He intends to buy a car to expand his business.

Poor prices for farm produce and the high costs of farm inputs are some of his challenges.

He likes the training that Juhudi Kilimo offers to farmers.

loans.use: To buy a water tank and irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is 42 years old and a farmer in the Nkubu area of Kenya.  She is widowed and lives with four of her children, who are all attending schools. She has been in farming for over 15 years producing cereals, which she sells locally.

Rael is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 for purchasing water tanks and irrigation equipment.  She will install that equipment in her acre piece of land to help her improve her produce and hence earn more income to be able to educate her children.

Lack of enough rainfall and of enough capital are some of the challenges she is facing in farming.

Rael thanks Juhudi Kilimo for their faster processing of loans.

loans.use: To buy water tanks and irrigation equipment.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru: Людмила использовала предыдущий кредит на закупку одежды и получила дополнительную прибыль. В это раз Людмила просит предоставить ей кредит на закупку зимних курток на оптовом рынке, где ей удалось договориться о значительной скидке. Людмила планирует ставить небольшую наценку и таким образом привлечь больше покупателей.
texts.en: Ludmila used her previous loan to purchase a batch of clothing and was able to make additional profits from their sale. This time Ludmila is requesting a loan for purchasing winter jackets for a whole sale price with an additional discount she was able to arrange with the sellers. Ludmila is planning to sell the jackets at a discounted price herself and so attract more customers for her store.

loans.use: to purchase winter jackets at a significant discount

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children from Antequera, Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a basket-making business for more than 15 years now. Lucia works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. She is asking for a loan worth 5,000 PHP to buy materials to make baskets. In the future, Lucia wants to make her business a success and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy materials to make baskets

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en: Angelie is 20 years old and married with a one-year-old baby girl. Her husband makes handicrafts for an income. She and her family live in Bien Unido, Bohol. Angelie is a hardworking woman that, despite having to take care of her baby, still manages to be a food vendor selling home-cooked snacks like banana cue (deep-fried bananas in caramelized sugar). She is asking for a loan to buy more bananas, cooking oil and brown sugar. Angelie hopes to have another business someday so she can provide for her child.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, cooking oil and brown sugar

loans.name: Armando

texts.en: Armando is 37 years old and married with three children ages 4, 7 and 8. He is from Trinidad, Bohol. His wife is a Globe (telecommunications company) messenger, while he works as a refrigeration and television technician. He works hard to provide for his family. He is asking for a loan to buy more tools that he can use for his business, such as a hammer, pliers, screwdrivers, telescoping and retractable inspection mirrors, and wrenches. A loan will help him sustain his business. He hopes that in the future he can better improve his business so he can provide a better service for his customers.

loans.use: to buy a hammer, pliers, screwdrivers, telescoping and retractable inspection mirrors, and wrenches

loans.name: Ester Consuelo

texts.es:
Doña Ester es una persona humilde, honesta y trabajadora vive con su esposo y uno de sus seis hijos en la comunidad de La Chorrera al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la crianza y venta de cerdos.
Doña Ester el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de: cerdos con el préstamo ella espera tener más animales para engordar y ofrecer a sus clientes y con esto aumentar las ventas  a igual que con los ingresos mejorar el estilo de vida de su familia.
Doña Ester en el futuro espera que su negocio crezca considerablemente y que sea el más conocido de la zona y a su vez seguir apoyando a su familia para que vivan mejor.
Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre 2012
texts.en:
Ester is a humble, honest, and hard-working person. She lives with her husband, and one of her six children, in the community of La Chorrera in southern Honduras. Her business is raising and selling pigs. 

Ester needs the loan to buy pigs. With the loan, she hopes to have more animals to fatten and offer to her customers; and with this, increase sales, as well as use the income to improve her family's lifestyle.

In the future, Ester hopes that her business will grow considerably, and be the best known in the area. In turn, she hopes to continue helping her family, so that they can live better. 

Choluteca, Honduras – September 2012

loans.use: To buy pigs for her business.

loans.name: 0201006 Thôn 3 - Hoằng Đông Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngọc works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future.

Ngọc is 39 years old, and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 0201006 Thôn 3 - Hoằng Đông solidarity group. 

Ngoc supports two dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2002, Ngọc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Ngọc has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Ngọc has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Ngọc faces in her business is the lack of capital. In the future, Ngọc hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future.

loans.name: Gloria Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Gloria de 37 años de edad es casada, tiene tres hijos, que viven con ella en su casa, ella se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de achinería de manera ambulante y en su casa ella vende charamuscas, choco bananos, queso, agua en bolsa, ubicada en la comunidad de La Caucara al sur de Honduras.
Doña Gloria solicita el préstamo para la compra de queso, agua, leche y achinería, con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende salir adelante en su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Doña Gloria su sueño es mejorar su casa  y también su negocio y tiene como proyecto empezar a vender ropa.
SAN LORENZO, HONDURAS - Septiembre del 2012.
texts.en:
Gloria, 37, is married and has 3 children who live at home with her. For some years she has had a business selling miscellaneous low-cost items door-to-door, and at home she sells candies, chocolate bananas, cheese and bags of water. She lives in the community of La Caucara in the south of Honduras.

Gloria asks for a loan to buy cheese, water, milk and miscellaneous items. With the support of this loan she plans to get ahead in her business and improve her family's quality of life.

Gloria's dream is to improve her house and also her business, and she has a plan to start selling clothing. 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2012

loans.use: to buy cheese, water, milk and miscellaneous goods.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 55-year-old married man. He has eight children with ages ranging from 6 years to 28 years. He describes himself to be a faithful man. 

He operates a retail business where he sells tiles, boxes, lamps, water containers, etc. He has been involved in this business for 25 years and employs two staff members. His business is located at a strategic business area, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of raw materials for the blacksmith. 

He will use the 12,900 Kenyan shillings loan to buy a solar lamp, which will be used by his  family members. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will improve his business by attracting more customers to it.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es:
Doña Daysi es una persona honesta, trabajadora y responsable vive con sus hijos en un barrio de Choluteca al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es el servicio de taxi en la ciudad de Choluteca.
Doña Daysi el préstamo lo necesita para realizarle mantenimiento y overhoul al vehículo. Con el préstamo ella espera arreglar y mejorar su taxi para mejorar el servicio prestado a sus clientes y que su unidad este en perfectas condiciones para no interrumpir la labor que su taxi realiza. Doña Daysi pretende que con su unidad en mejor estado sus ingresos aumenten y su taxi este mejor mecánicamente.
Doña Daysi en el futuro espera contar con un vehículo mas para prestar este servicio y así mismo que los ingresos aumenten para mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia y con esto seguir apoyando la educación de sus hijos y que sean personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades.
Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre 2012
texts.en:
Daysi is honest, hardworking and responsible. She lives with her kids in a neighborhood in Choluteca in the south of Honduras. Her business is providing taxi service in the city of Choluteca.

Daysi needs the loan to do maintenance and overhaul her vehicle. With the loan she hopes to fix and improve her taxi so that she can improve the service she provides her customers by having her unit in perfect condition so as not to interrupt her taxi's work. Daysi expects that with her taxi in better shape, her income will increase and the mechanics will work better.

In the future Daysi hopes to have another vehicle for this service and to increase her income to improve her family's quality of life and continue supporting her children's education so that they will be upstanding and have better opportunities. 
Choluteca, Honduras - September 2012

loans.use: to repair her taxi.

loans.name: Aracely

texts.es:
Aracely, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de Yoro junto a su esposo y dos de sus hijos. 
Hace 3 años que estableció su propio negocio donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como manteca, arroz, azúcar, sal, pastas, confites, productos enlatados, jabón, condimentos, etc. este negocio lo mantiene surtido mediante la inversión de ganancias y ya tiene buena demanda de clientes. Ella solicito este préstamo por la cantidad de 13,000 Lempiras para surtir e incrementar las ventas, comprara más productos de consumo diario como arroz, azúcar, manteca, harina, sal, churros, refrescos, confites, y otros. Y tiene como meta seguir trabajando con el negocio para incrementar los ingresos y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Aracely is 37. She is married, has three children, and lives with her husband and two of her children, in the municipality of Yoro. 

She set up her own store three years ago, where she sells basic household goods, such as lard, rice, sugar, salt, pasta, sweets, canned goods, soap, condiments, etc. 

She keeps this business stocked by reinvesting her earnings, and now has good customer demand.  She requested this loan, in the amount of 13,000 lempiras, in order to restock and increase sales. 

She will buy more products for everyday use, such as rice, sugar, lard, flour, salt, churros (fried dough treat), soft drinks, sweets, and other items. 

Her goal is to continue working with the store, in order to increase her income and help her family.

loans.use: To buy food products such as lard, rice, salt, sugar, flour, soft drinks, and churros (a fried dough treat), for stocking her store.

loans.name: Suyapa Concepcion

texts.es:
La señora Suyapa de  43 años de edad, vive con su conyugue y sus dos hijos en su casa de habitación ubicada en la comunidad de Nacaome, al sur de Honduras, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, en su casa y sale por las tardes y la mañana a venderlas al mercado de Nacaome, Doña Suyapa es una mujer muy trabajadora y con deseos de seguir adelante.
Doña Suyapa esta solicitando 10,000.00 lempiras para compra de maíz y leña, estos son la materia prima que ella utiliza para realizar su actividad. Con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende suplir la necesidad de financiamiento para su negocio y seguir adelante con su proyecto que es terminar de construir su casa.
Doña Suyapa su sueño ya casi hecho realidad es terminar su casa, con las utilidades generadas por el préstamo ella desea suplir otras necesidades de ella y su familia. Ella esta muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma en sus préstamos.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre  del 2012
texts.en:
Suyapa, 43, lives with her husband and two children in her house located in the community of Nacaome, in the south of Honduras.  She earns a living making and selling tortillas in her house.  She goes out in the afternoon and the morning to the Nacaome market to sell them.  Suyapa is a very hardworking woman who wants to get ahead.

Suyapa is requesting 10,000 lempiras [HNL] to buy corn and firewood, the raw materials she uses to do her job.  With the help of this loan she plans to supply the finances for her business and move forward with her project, which is to finish her house.

Suyapa's dream to finish her house has almost come true.  With the profits generated by the loan she wants to fulfill other personal and family needs.  She's very happy to continue working with Prisma on her loans.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, September 2012

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for her business

loans.name: Rosalia Esther

texts.es:
Rosalía es una mujer de 57 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, lastimosamente por diversas razones, desde hace varios años Rosalía se separó de su pareja, desde entonces ella dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocer; por la falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven, Rosalía no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar repostería, en algunas ocasiones ella cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Rosalía tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de churros y pan con pollo, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella prepara sus alimentos y sale a recorrer las calles de su ciudad para realizar sus ventas, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Rosalía se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una máquina de hacer churros e insumos para preparar sus productos; de esta manera Rosalía podrá contar con una herramienta de trabajo adecuada para preparar sus productos, así ella espera aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder ampliar su negocio y así en un futuro no muy lejano desea poder tener su local propio de venta de comida.
texts.en:
Rosalia, 57, lives in the city of Chincha with her son, whom she loves and who is her main reason for living. Unfortunately, for a number of reasons, she separated from her partner some years ago. Since then, she has dedicated all of her efforts to getting her family ahead. In her free time she likes to cook. For lack of economic resources and the need to work from a very young age, Rosalia wasn't able to study a professional career but she would have very much liked to study pastry making. Sometimes she cooks a delicious carapulcra con sopa seca [a spicy dried-potato stew with noodles] to share with her family.

By her own initiative, with a lot of dedication, Rosalia has a small business selling churros and chicken sandwiches. Every day from very early she begins work, preparing her foods and going out to the streets of the city to sell them. She can work 12 hours a day and thinks that it's going well because of her dedication and the friendly treatment she gives her customers. 

Rosalia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help given her she will be able to buy a machine to make churros and ingredients to prepare her products. This way she will have an adequate tool to make her goods and she hopes to increase her sales and her income, which will be very helpful for increasing the size of her business. In the not-so-distant future she hopes to have her own locale for selling food.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and a machine to make churros.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La señora Andrea tiene más de diez años dedicándose al comercio de venta de ropa usada y nueva. Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en comprar de mercancía de ropa de temporada de invierno.
La señora Andrea tiene poco tiempo que se separo de su esposo y se quedo con las responsabilidades de tres hijos que están estudiando, dos de sus hijos estudian la secundaria y su hija estudia la preparatoria, desea darles es estudio necesario para que sean unos triunfadores.
Con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio una parte será para pagar el crédito, ya que con esta invención va a dejar mejore ganancias.
texts.en:
Andrea has been selling new and used clothing for more than ten years. She is applying for a loan in order to invest in the purchase of clothing merchandise for the winter season. 

Andrea separated from a husband not long ago, and was left with the responsibility of three children who are in school. Two of her children go to junior secondary school and a daughter is in high school. She wishes to provide them with the education they need to be successful in life.  

With the earnings she gets from her store, a part will be to pay off the loan, as with this investment, the business is going to yield more profits.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her clothing business.

loans.name: Elsa Evangelina

texts.es:
La señora Elsa y su esposo tienen tres hijos que están estudiando la primaria y secundaria a quienes les quieren dar el estudio necesario para que sean unos triunfadores.
La señora Elsa esta solicitando un préstamo para reparar el techo de su vivienda, antes de que llegue la temporada de lluvia y que sus bienes se maltrataran, la salud de su familia se vea afectada.
La señora Elsa se dedica a realizar trabajos de belleza en su domicilio y su esposo trabaja en una empresa de productos de botanas como chofer de entrega, con las ganancias que obtiene la señora Elsa de su negocio será para pagar el crédito y el sueldo que recibe su esposo será para los gastos familiares y escolares.
texts.en:
Elsa and her husband have three children who are studying in primary and secondary school. They want to give them the necessary education to be successful. 

Elsa is requesting a loan to repair the roof of her house, before the rainy season arrives, her goods get damaged and the health of her family affected. Elsa is dedicated to perform beauty jobs at home and her husband works in a snacks company as a delivery driver. 

With the profits Elsa obtains from her business she will pay the loan and the salary her husband receives will be used for family and school expenses.

loans.use: to repair the roof.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is a 55-year-old married man. He has seven children with ages ranging from 14 years to 27 years. He describes himself to be a caring man. 

He operates a retail business where he sells water. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in a slum area, and his primary customers are residents within the slum area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity within the area. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to purchase another water tank, which will be used for water storage for selling to customers. His business goal is to improve his business within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will improve the living standards of his family. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Yenis Arsenia

texts.es:
Doña  Yenis es una persona muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora vive con su esposo en un barrio de Choluteca, al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta de pollo frito y refrescos.
Doña Yenis el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de: pollo, refrescos, churros y condimentos. Con el préstamo ella espera que sus ventas aumenten al tener más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes y poder cubrir los pedidos que estos le hacen a diario, así mismo  con el aumento de los ingresos mejorar su  estilo de vida y el de su familia.
Doña Yenis en unos años espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en el más grande y conocido de la zona y a su vez que su familia viva de una manera digna y sin preocupaciones.
Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre 2012
texts.en:
Yenis is a very responsible, honest, and hardworking person.  She lives with her husband in a neighborhood of Choluteca, in the south of Honduras.  Her business is selling fried chicken and soft drinks.

Yenis needs the loan to buy chicken, soft drinks, "churros" [fried dough], and condiments.  She hopes her sales increase with the loan because she has more products to sell to her customers and is able to cover their daily orders.  She also wants to increase her income and improve her living conditions and those of her family.

Yenis hopes her business will grow in the future and turn into the biggest and best known in the area.  She also hopes her family will live a decent and carefree life.

Choluteca, Honduras, September 2012

loans.use: to buy chicken, soft drinks, fried dough, and condiments

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio, de 69 años de edad, habita en la comarca La Flecha en las afueras de Teustepe, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol. Actividad que realiza desde hace 23 años, no tuvo educación escolar, pues la mayor parte de su vida la dedica a trabajar para poder comer. Empezó sembrando hortalizas y después siembras de granos básicos. Todos sus hijos son casados y viven aparte. Todo lo que cultiva lo vende en la misma comunidad, pues no tiene los recursos suficientes para costear los gastos que implica vender fuera de la comunidad. 
Él requiere el financiamiento para comprar abono, fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra para sembrar maíz. Esto le ayudara a darle un mejor mantenimiento a su cosecha de la cual espera que tenga alto rendimiento y buena calidad. Él dice que una vez que cancele su crédito desea continuar mejorando las labores de siembra y crianza de ganado.
texts.en:
Antonio, 69, lives in the La Flecha region on the outskirts of Teustepe.  All his children are married and live on their own.  He didn't have an education because the majority of his life he has had to work to be able to eat.  

He makes a living growing corn and beans, a job he has been doing for 23 years.  He began growing vegetables and then basic grains.  He sells everything he grows in his own community because he doesn't have the resources to finance selling outside his community.

He needs the loan to buy manure and fertilizer, and to pay for labor to grow corn.

This will help him to better maintain his harvest, which he hopes will have a high yield and good quality.  He says that once he pays back his loan he wants to continue improving his work growing and in raising livestock.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer and to pay for labor to grow corn

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a 39-year-old married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 14 years. He describes himself to be an honest man. He operates a retail store where he sells home products such as sugar, salt, flour etc . He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity within the area. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more home products for sale. His goal is to improve his business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve the living standard of his family. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy home products for sale

loans.name: Kenedy

texts.en: Kenedy is a 27-year-old married man. He has a child. He describes himself to be an honest and obedient man. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located at a market and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high prices of clothes and stiff competition within the market. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy clothes for resale. His goal is to improve his business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will expand his business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a 43-year-old mother of five children, ages 8 to 18. They live in San Miguel, Bohol, Philippines. She is currently in a hog raising business to earn an income for her family. She works hard in her business hoping that it could help her sustain the needs of her family, especially her children. 

Presently, Josefina needs additional capital of 3,000 PHP to buy another piglet and hog feed for her piggery business. She is certain that through this loan she can further maintain and improve her livelihood. She is looking for a better future for her business, and she hopes that one day it could house more hogs for a bigger profit. With the income from the business, she can provide a better future for her children, as well as a healthy diet for her family.

loans.use: to buy another piglet and hog feed

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en: Natividad is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Calituban, Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fish vending business for more than 20 years now. Natividad works hard to earn a living so that she can support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. Natividad has been a member of CEVI for several years now. She likes the financial services offered by the organization to micro-entrepreneurs like her. As of now, she is asking for a loan of 17,000 PHP to buy more fish and sea cucumbers and other sea products to sell to the market. Moreover, she is also planning to renovate her house. In the future, Natividad hopes to make her business a success so that it will generate more revenue for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy more fish and sea cucumbers to sell

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en: Vivencia is a 45-year-old woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with 5 children ages 8 to 23. Vivencia has had a business making brick stoves for 5 years now. This is her main source of income as she helps her husband who works as a farmer. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy steel, cement and sand which is needed for her stove production. Her loan will be a big help so she can sustain her business while also supporting her family's needs. In the future, she hopes to see her children successful in their studies.

loans.use: to buy steel, cement and sand

loans.name: Wilna

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Wilna works hard to support her family. She has a buying and selling coconut business in the Philippines and also earns an additional income from her general store. Wilna is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more coconut to sell to her customers.

Wilna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more coconut to sell to customers.

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Sofía le esta haciendo falta los acabados del exterior que es pintar y reparar las paredes de afuera.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar el material ya que su esposo se encargara de realizar la mejora.
La señora Sofía es empleada de una fábrica en el aria de producción y su esposo trabaja en la construcción (Albañil) estos son los ingreso que tiene para darle lo mejor a su hijo que esta estudiando la secundaria.
Con el sueldo que obtiene la señora Sofía será para pagar el crédito y que el ingreso de su esposo será para los gastos familiares y escolares.
Desean mejorar la calidad de vida y el patrimonio de su hijo.
texts.en:
Sofía's house needs the finishing touches on the exterior, which are painting and repairing the outside walls.  She's requesting the loan to buy the material because her husband is going to do the improvements.

Sofía works in a factory in the area of production and her husband works in construction as a bricklayer.  This is the income she has to give the best to her son, who is in secondary school.

She'll use her salary to pay back the loan and her husband's income for the family and school expenses.

They want to improve their quality of life and their son's inheritance.

loans.use: to finish the exterior of her house

loans.name: Abegail

texts.en: Abegail is a 33-year-old woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with two children ages 7 and 9. She started a fishing business nine years ago so that she could help support her family, especially her husband. Together, this is their main livelihood. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy an engine, plywood, rope and nails to be used for repair. When these are ready, she will be assured of continued fishing activity so she can support her family. Her income will provide food and school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to have another business that she can expand for her family.

loans.use: to buy an engine, plywood, rope and nails

loans.name: Germocila

texts.en:
Germocila is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of four children the ages of four, six, eleven, and fourteen. Germocila is in engaged in a hog-raising business. She also runs a sari-sari (convenience store) selling various goods.

Germocila is requesting a loan worth PHP 10,000 to buy feed for the pigs, and to buy additional merchandise to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soap, and shampoo.

In the future, Germocila dreams of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to continue to send her children to school for their bright future.

loans.use: to buy feeds for the pigs, and to buy additional merchandise to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soap, and shampoo

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a married woman and a mother of seven children from Antequera, Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in basket-making. She also runs a sari-sari store, or convenience store, selling various goods to the people in the community.

Fe is in need of financial capital for her business. She is asking for a loan worth 4,000 PHP to buy materials for making baskets and additional merchandise to sell such as dry goods, canned goods and noodles.

In the future, Fe dreams of expanding her business and making it sustainable.

loans.use: to buy materials for making baskets and additional merchandise to sell such as dry goods, canned goods and noodles

loans.name: Flor Del Oriente Group

texts.es: Wendy es una mujer joven y responsable de 23 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos pequeños de 2 y 4 años de edad. Ella es integrante del grupo flor del oriente y se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo. Wendy comenzó su negocio por medio de su madre, ya que ella también había vendido zapatos y la invito a entrar y gustosa ella acepto, ya que antes había vendido otro tipo de artículos por catalogo. Con el crédito ella surtirá mas zapatos para la temporada de invierno. Wendy desea que su negocio prospere y seguirá comprando mas zapatos, para poder hacer tandas, además de las ventas normales.
texts.en:
Wendy, 23, is a responsible young woman.  She's married and has two small children, ages 2 and 4.

She's a member of Flor del Oriente Group and makes a living selling shoes from a catalogue.  Wendy started her business because of her mother, who also had sold shoes and invited her to start.  She happily accepted because she had done catalogue sales in the past.

With the loan she'll stock more shoes for the winter season.

Wendy wants her business to prosper, and she'll continue buying more shoes to be able to make group as well as normal sales.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for the winter season

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is 44 years old from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with four children ages 9-27. Her husband works as a farmer and Alicia is into operating a sari-sari store (general store) where she sells basic household needs like toiletries, seasoning and canned goods. This business started 24 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy items in bulk like detergent, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, chips, noodles and canned goods. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to make her store bigger so she can better provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy items in bulk for her store

loans.name: Welyneth

texts.en: Welyneth is 24 years old from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married and has a 3-year-old daughter. Welyneth has been engaged in a sari-sari store business for three years now, while her husband operates a fishing boat business. Welyneth would like to improve her inventory level and include buying items in bulk for a better profit. She is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy items like detergent, shampoo, canned goods, bath soap, chips, candies and seasoning. She hopes that with the help of the loan she will be able to increase her income for her family. She also dreams of sending her child to school someday.

loans.use: to buy items like detergent, shampoo, canned goods, bath soap, chips, candies and seasoning.

loans.name: Aylol Group

texts.en: The four members of Aylol group live in a working-class neighborhood of the city of Sana`a, Yemen. The whole group took out a loan of 170,000 YER. Fatima, the coordinator of her group, is 47 years old. She has operated a business selling fabrics and perfumes, etc. for only 4 years. Fatima`s most important challenges are to work hard to gain extra income and to better her business structure. She is receiving a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy perfumes, incense and fabrics for her business. She hopes to buy a bus.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, incense and fabrics for her business.

loans.name: Qais

texts.en: Qais is 35 years old and is from Sana`a, Yemen. He is married and has two children. He has completed his bachelor. Qais owns a taxi and labors to meet his family`s expenses. He is asking for a loan of 100,000 YER to buy spare parts. He hopes to open a business store so he gets profits and enrolls his children to private school.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his transportation

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is 43 years old, married and supports a family of five people. He has done a hawking business for a variety of home care merchandise for the last eight years earning a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

He is applying for his first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD which he intends to use to set up business premises. The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep keeping. 

His future dream is to improve his financial stability and own a pickup transport business.

loans.use: to set up business premises.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 41-year-old married woman and a resident of Bien Unido, Bohol, Philippines. She has 7 children ages 4-19. She has been in the business of fishing  for fourteen years now. Her husband is a fisherman and she works hard to help support the family. The business is not always good, especially if the weather is not conducive to fishing, like if there is typhoon and storm, but they persevere for their family’s sake.  She is asking for a loan of 8000 PHP to buy a new fish net.

Marilyn  hopes that she could expand her ventures and earn a bigger income so she can provide for her children’s needs.

loans.use: to buy a new fish net.

loans.name: Rahmatjon

texts.ru: Рахматджон обратился в нашу организацию за финансовой поддержкой так как нуждается а корме для скота.   Он  отец 5 детей.    Всю свою жизнь он занимается откормом скота так как не имеет образования.   Его сыновья помогают в разведении скота.    Сейчас у него много коров, но денег на корм не хватает, чтобы до весны прокормить свой скот поэтому планирует закупить корм.  Это единственный доход в семье поэтому он хочет развивать свой бизнес. Рахматчон мечтает обучить своих детей чтобы они получили образование и работали по профессии.   Он очень надеется на финансовую поддержку от организации Арванд.
texts.en:
Rahmatjon has contacted our organization for financial support as he needs to buy feed for his livestock.  

He is the father of five children.  He has never attended school and has been involved in the fattening of livestock all his life.  His sons help him to raise livestock.  

He now has a lot of cows, but he doesn't have enough money to feed them until the spring, which is why he is planning to buy some feed.  Since Rahmatjon's business is his family's only source of income, he would like to expand his activity. 

His dream is to send his sons to school so that they get an education and have good jobs. 

He looks very forward to receiving financial support from MDO Arvand.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed.

loans.name: Kanou Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Kanou ont en moyenne  42 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  Tamaro, un des villages relevant de la  commune de San.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de produits alimentaires tels les condiments alimentaires,  les céréales, les articles de boutiques (lait, sucre, thé etc.)  et les fruits et légumes.
Après avoir correctement remboursés le 1er prêt, les femmes du groupe Kanou sont à leur deuxième  prêt solidaire. Minata Lamine, 2 eme personne debout sur la photo de la gauche vers la droite,  compte utiliser pour acheter, 1 bidon d’huile alimentaire, des poivres, des tomates fraîches, des oignons, des aubergines, des paniers de grains de céréales et quelques  paniers de fruits et légumes. 
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de San et effectue ses ventes, dans mon village  de Tamaro, à domicile et la foire hebdomadaire, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women who compose the KANOU group are, on average, 42 years old with six children each.  They all live in extended traditional families in Tamaro, one of the villages of the commune of San.  

They know each other through family ties and they sell food products and grocery items such as condiments for cooking, grains, fruits and vegetables, milk, sugar, tea etc. 

They have duly repaid their first loan and are now taking their second solidarity loan.  

Minata Lamine (second from the left in the photo) is planning to use her loan to buy one can of cooking oil, some peppers, fresh tomatoes, onions, eggplants, baskets of grains and a few baskets of fruits and vegetables.

She buys her supplies at the Grand Market in San and resells her goods in her own village of Tamaro, from her home and at the weekly market.  She sells for cash and sometimes on credit to a retail group of customers consisting of men and women.

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 CFA francs, which will be used in part to buy food and cover healthcare costs and school fees, while the rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady est une femmes mariée qui vit avec son époux et ses quatre enfants.L'activité principale dans sa localité est l'agriculture.Ainsi , elle exploite pour son propre compte une parcelle de terre sur laquelle elle cultive différentes variétés de melon.Une fois sa production vendue, elle prend en charge les dépenses d'entretien de ses enfants ainsi que ses propres besoins.Elle sollicite un pret de 250 000f pour acheter des semences et des engrais.
texts.en: Khady is a married woman, who lives with her husband and their four children. The main activity in her region is agriculture. As a result, she farms for her own account a piece of land where she grows different varieties of melon. Once her crop is sold, she is able to cover her childcare costs and her own basic needs. She is seeking a loan of 250,000f in order to purchase seed and fertiliser.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertiliser.

loans.name: Kelle Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de deux femmes fait partie du Banc Villageois Kelle, créé le 30 décembre 2009. Elles habitent le même village et sont en bonne entente.

Rokhaya, la présidente du groupe est une femme de 38 ans. Elle est divorcée et mère de 04 enfants dont 03 filles et 01 garçon. Elle fait du petit commerce de légumes. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus de 03 ans. Elle tient aussi une boutique d'alimentation générale dans le village. Sur la photo, elle est habillée en bleu et a levé la main gauche.

Avec son prêt elle voudrai acheter 03 sacs de choux,02 de patates, 03 de maniocs, 01 d’aubergines, gombo et sucre, 20 litres d'huile.

Avec ses bénéfices elle a la charge de la famille(nourriture, scolarité et santé).
texts.en:
The group Kelle consists of two members and is part of the local Banc Villageois, created on December 30, 2009. The two women live in the same village and get along well. 

Rokhaya, age 38, is the president of the group. She is the lady wearing blue and raising her left hand. She is a divorced mother of four children, 3 girls and a boy. She has been selling vegetables for over 3 years, and she also runs a general food store in the village. 

She will use her loan to buy three bags of cabbage, two sacks of potatoes, three bags of cassava root, one bag of eggplants, some gumbo, some sugar, and 20 liters of oil. 

She will use her profits to provide for her family (food, tuition and healthcare).

loans.use: to buy vegetables and merchandise for her food store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase his own motorcycle

loans.name: Fatoumata Mallé

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata Mallé une veuve de 44 ans vit avec ses 8 enfants, dont l’ainé a 17 ans et le plus jeune, 2 ans. Elle est une brave femme car depuis 7 ans maintenant, elle travaille pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants . Elle n’a jamais eu de crédit au niveau de l’IMCEC et vient solliciter 200000F CFA afin d’acheter de l’arachide et du mil et de le revendre dans le marché local. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à13h.
 Avec les enfants, il faut toujours être à leurs petits soins : habillements, scolarité, argent de poche pour les petits besoins au quotidien.
Etant soutien de famille, elle a besoin d’augmenter son fond de commerce pour améliorer ses ventes et maximiser son profit afin d’arriver toujours à satisfaire ses enfants bien que c’est très dure d’y arriver.
texts.en:
Fatoumata Mallé is a 44-year-old widow who lives with her eight children, ages 2 to 17 years old.  She is a very courageous woman who has been working to provide for her family for the past seven years.

She has never before taken a loan with UIMCEC, and she is now requesting 200,000 CFA francs to buy groundnut and millet which she will resell at the local market.  She works from 8 o'clock in the morning until 1 o'clock in the afternoon.

She is always trying to meet the needs of her children: she has to buy clothes, pay school fees, provide pocket money for small daily needs...
As the family provider, Fatoumata Mallé needs to boost her business in order to increase her sales and maximize her profits.  Although she is finding this very difficult, her goal is to always satisfy the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy groundnut and millet for resale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is applying for her second loan with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Irene will use the loan to buy more stock of new clothes for sale in the coming high season. 


With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to expand the business and open a boutique.

loans.use: to buy more stock of new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Aminata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est crée le 21 décembre 2009. Les membres le composant entretiennent de bonnes relations , leur principale activité est le petit commerce.

Debout à droite de la photo, Aminata la vedette est âgée 31 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 01 garçons et 03 filles. 

Son prêt reçu , elle achète des seaux de pâte d'arachide à 8 000 frs l'unité de 20 kgs dans les marchés hebdomadaires  pour revendre à 15 000 frs. Elle achète également 02 sacs de détergent à 8 000 frs l'un et les revendre à 12 000 frs l'unité.

Avec les bénéfices elle subvient à ses besoins et soutient son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Le bv was created on December 21, 2009.  The members enjoy good relationships and they are mainly involved in small businesses. 

Standing to the right in the photo, Aminata, the youngest, is 31 years old.  She is married and the mother of 4 children; one boy and three girls.

With her loan she will buy tubs of peanut butter for 8000 frs per 20 kgs at the weekly markets, to resell at 15,000 frs.  She will also buy two sacks of detergent at 8,000 frs each and resell them at 12,000 frs. 

With the profits she will be able to take care of her needs and help her husband meet family responsibilities.

loans.use: tu buy merchandise (peanut butter at retail and detergents).

loans.name: Makane

texts.fr:
Makane  est un jeune qui est très tôt entré dans le commerce. Il a acquis une expérience de plus de 10 ans. Il est marié et père de famille. Makane dispose d’un atelier de couture ou il fait de la coupe et confection d’habits pour homme et femme. Avec  son activité, il a besoin d’acheter de la garniture pour toute coupe, c’est pourquoi, il a pensé investir aussi dans la mercerie tout dans le même  atelier. Avec  le crédit de 300000F CFA, il va acheter des marchandises de mercerie : fil, renfort, fermeture, garniture, boutons…
Makane appuie à la dépense quotidienne de la famille. Il a comme ambition d’équiper son atelier pour qu’il soit plus attrayant.
texts.en:
Makane is a young man, who started his business very early. He already has ten years of experience. He is married and the father of a family. Makane owns a tailoring workshop, where he makes clothes for men and women. For his workshop, he needs to buy trim for each item of clothing, which is why he thought of also investing in sewing supply sales in the same workshop. With the loan of 300,000 FCFA, he is ging to buy sewing supplies to sell: thread, lining material, zippers, trim, buttons...

Makane supports the daily expenses of his family. His ambition is to equip his workshop and make it more attractive.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies: thread, lining material, zippers, trim, buttons

loans.name: Elisabeth Siga's Group

texts.fr:
BV créé le 13 décembre 2008 est composé par l'association des femmes catholiques qui de par leur entente et solidarité ont accepté d'ouvrir à d'autres femmes le BV.
Élisabeth, âgée de 50 ans, est veuve et mère de 6 enfants et 07 autres en charge. Elle s'occupe elle même de sa famille car n'ayant pas de soutien. Elle fait du petit commerce, vente de poissons au marché.
Avec le prêt reçu elle va acheter 10 casiers de poissons cela dépend des catégories qu'on trouve sur le marché.
Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettent d'assurer la nourriture de la famille, de prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants.Elle a pu aussi renforcer ses épargnes et payer ses intérêts grâces à son activité de petit commerce
texts.en:
This banc villageois, created on December 13, 2008, is a Catholic Women's Association whose members, moved by a feeling of amity and solidarity, have decided to open their group to other women.

Élisabeth, age 50, is a widow and the mother of six children with an additional seven children in her care.  She takes care of her family alone, without any support.

She is involved in retail and sells fish at the market.

Élisabeth will use her loan to buy 10 crates of fish.  The type of fish she buys depends on what is available on the market.

With the profits from her activity, Élisabeth is able to feed her family and to cover school fees for her children.  She has also been able to strengthen her savings and to pay her interest thanks to her small retail activity.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Kouchéssi Albert

texts.fr: Kouchéssi Albert est âgé de 28 ans et vit au Bénin. Kouchéssi Albert est un célibataire. Kouchéssi Albert vit seul et assure ses divers besoins. Kouchéssi Albert a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Afin d’assurer ses divers besoins, Kouchéssi Albert mène comme activité depuis sept ans, l’agriculture dans sa région. Parallèlement à cette activité, Kouchéssi Albert est un aide soignant. Kouchéssi Albert désire agrandir son activité d’agriculture par la culture d’une grande surface de maïs. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Kouchéssi Albert sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Kouchéssi Albert is 28 years old and lives in Benin. He is single and lives alone. He takes care of his own various needs. Kouchéssi Albert has attended secondary school.

In order to meet his different needs, Kouchéssi Albert has been farming in his area for 7 years. In addition to this activity, he is also a caregiver.

Kouchéssi Albert wishes to increase his farming by cultivating a large area of corn. 

In pursuit of customer satisfaction and to increase turnover and his income, Kouchéssi Albert is asking, for a second time, a loan from Alidé. This loan will allow him to increase his level of farming and to earn more profits. His first loan has been fully repaid.

loans.use: Acheter d'autres surfaces pour l'agriculture.

loans.name: Latifou

texts.fr: Latifou vit avec sa femme revendeuse et leurs 03 enfants tous scolarisés à Lomé. Ils sont âgés de 14 à 05ans. Mr Latifou est conducteur de taxi depuis 2000. Afin d’acheter du moteur pour sa voiture, il sollicite un cinquième prêt à WAGES. Avec les profits, il veut acheter d’autres voitures neuves tout en assurant les besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Latifou lives in Lomé with his wife (a re-seller) and their three children, all of wom attend school and are aged between 5 and 14 years old. Mr Latifou has been a taxi driver since 2000. In order to purchase an engine for his car, he is asking for a fifth loan from WAGES. He hopes to use the profits to purchase additional new cars, all the while attending to the needs of his family.

loans.use: purchase an engine for his taxi

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 33 years old and is married with two children who are 5 and 7 years old. He owns a business of transporting people. He has been in this business for 2 years and he works from 5 am until 10 pm every day. 

Samuel has requested a Kiva loan, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase spare parts (tires, engine, mirror, etc.) for his motorcycle transport business. With his profits, he will be able to save for his future and to pay medical insurance.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts (tires, engine, mirror, etc.) for his motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Essi mariée à un soudeur ferrailleur, est âgée de 36ans. Elle est mère de 03 enfants dont 02 à l’école. Elle est revendeuse de profession, vend des assiettes  et fait en même temps la restauration. Afin d’agrandir son activité, et mieux répondre aux besoins des clients, elle sollicite de WAGES un premier prêt.  Elle voudrait réinvestir dans l’activité et subvenir aux moindres besoins de la famille. Elle est dans ce domaine il y a 04ans.
texts.en:
Essé is married to a welder / scrap dealer and she is 36 years old.  She has three children, two of whom attend school.

Essé is a professional reseller: she sells plates and also prepares meals.  

In order to boost her activity and to better meet her customers' needs, she is requesting a first loan from WAGES.  

She would like to reinvest in her activity and meet all of her family's needs.  She has been involved in this business for the past four years.

loans.use: to buy plates and ingredients to prepare meals.

loans.name: Gbedokpo Group

texts.fr: GBEDOKPO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, Mahougnon Marie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 38 ans et est mariée à un certain Paul. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés. Mahougnon Marie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Mahougnon Marie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de trois ans que Mahougnon Marie mène comme activité la vente de condiments et des viandes de bœufs à son domicile. Mahougnon Marie exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Mahougnon Marie s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Mahougnon Marie sollicite un quatrième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe GBEDOKPO. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: GBEDOKPO is a group of three friends. The group's representative, Mahougnon Marie (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 38 years old and married to a man named Paul. The couple has two children, both of whom are in school. Mahougnon Marie lives together with her children and her husband. The couple provides for the the children's various expenses together. Mahougnon Marie did not attend school. For nearly three years, Mahougnon Marie has been working selling seasonings and beef from her home. Mahougnon Marie works passionately in this business, which allows her to provide for her needs as well as those of her children. Mahougnon Marie stocks up in a city in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers, Mahougnon Marie is asking for a fourth loan with the other members of the GBEDOKPO group. This loan will be used to better respond to the needs of their customers and to make more profits. Their previous loans were repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy seasonings and beef skin.

loans.name: Carlos Yobany

texts.es:
El Señor Carlos  tiene 43 años de edad convive con sus hijos es padre soltero, Su actividad principal es la venta y siembra de café  desde hace más de 2 años.
Don Carlos esta solicitando el apoyo del préstamo para la compra de productos como ser: fertilizantes, abonos, compra de alimentos, pago a peones para la buena asistencia de su finca, en la comunidad donde el vive, es una persona muy trabajadora y se levanta muy temprano para atender sus actividades, con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo que reciba Don Carlos, le contribuirá a tener una mejor finca, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar, y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, para salir adelante.
Don Carlos sus sueños es poder mejorar su finca darle la asistencia necesaria y dejarles un buen patrimonio a sus hijos.

Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Septiembre 2012
texts.en:
Carlos, 43, is a single father and lives with his children.  His main activity is growing and selling coffee, and he has been in this business for two years.

Carlos is requesting a loan to buy products such as fertilizers, composts and feed, as well as hire farm workers in the community where he lives.  He is a very hard worker and gets up earlier in the morning to take care of his business.  With the help of the loan, Carlos will have a better farm and improve his income to cover household expenses and give his family a better quality of life.

Carlos' goal is to improve his farm by giving it the necessary attention so he can leave his children a good inheritance.

Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - September 2012

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, composts and feed, as well as hire farm workers.
